 Remember the name of Sathya Sai, Sadguru Sathya Sai
 Honor the name of Sathya Sai, Sadguru Sathya Sai
 Pray to the name of Sathya Sai, Sadguru Sathya Sai
 Adore the name of Sathya Sai, Sadguru Sathya Sai

title: Say the Name, say the Name
title2: Say the Name, say the Name, say the Name
lyrics:
The holy Name can remove a mountain of blame
 Say the Name, say the Name, say the Name, say the Name
 Om Sai Ram, Hari Om Sai Ram
 Hari Om Sai Ram
 Say the Name, say the Name, Say the Name,
 Say the holy Name, say it with devotion
 Purify the heart, quiet the emotions
 It's the little raft that takes us 'cross the ocean
 Say the Name
 Om Sai Ram, Hari Om Sai Ram
 Hari Om Sai Ram
 Say the Name, say the Name, say the Name,
 Say the Name, say the Name, say the Name

title: Sayeesha Sharanam Sharanam Sayeesha
lyrics:
Sathya Shivatmaka Sundara Esha [ Sayeesha ... ]
Tandava Rudra Sadashiva Sai
Karuna Sagara Raghava Sai
Gaana Manohara Madhava Sai
Madhava Sai Hey Madhava (Raghava) Sai
Buddhi Pradayaka Sambhava Sai
meaning: O Lord Sai, we surrender at Your Lotus Feet. You are the most beautiful and eternal one, the embodiment of all that is good and true. You are verily the most enchanting Cosmic Dancer Shiva, the most compassionate Rama as well as Krishna, the embodiment and connoisseur of all music. O Lord Sai, You are the one who bestows wisdom.

title: Sayeeshwara Jagadeeshwara
lyrics:
Parameshwara Partheeshwara [ Sayeeshwara ... ]
Karunamaya Jagat Kaarana
Shaileshwara Bhuvaneshwara
Kailasa Natha Maheshwara
meaning: Glory to Lord Shiva who is none other than Lord Sai residing in Puttaparthi. He is the Supreme Lord of the entire universe, the most compassionate one and the cause of all creation. He is the Lord of the mountains and this world. His abode is the mount Kailasa.

title: Sayeeshwari Amba Bhuvaneshwari
lyrics:
Partheeshwari Amba Parameshwari [ Sayeeshwari Amba ... ]
Omkara Roopini Akhileshwari
Uma Maheshwari Jagadeeshwari (Amba)
meaning: Salutations to You, Mother Sai, residing in Parthi. You are verily Mother Parvathi called by other names such as, Bhuvaneshwari, Parameshwari, Akhileshwari and Maheshwari. You are the primordial sound of 'Om' personified.

title: Sayeeshwari Amba Jagadeeshwari
lyrics:
Kalyani Kanchi Puri Kamakshi [ Sayeeshwari Amba ... ]
Partheeshwari Amba Parameshwari
Matangi Madura Puri Meenakshi
meaning: Salutations to Mother Sai whose abode is Parthi, who is the mother to this entire universe. She is also the presiding deity in Kanchi (by name Kamakshi) and Madurai (by name Meenakshi).

title: Sayeeshwari Chandramukhi
lyrics:
Sharanagatha Paripalini
Shashwata Ananda Dayini
Sharanam Sharanam Jaganmayi
meaning: Glory to you Oh Mother Sayeeshwari who is as resplendent and beautiful as the moon, to the one who showers on all of us eternal bliss and joy. We Offer our humble surrender to you Oh mother Sai.

title: Sayi Engal Annaiyam Sayi Engal
title2: Sayi Engal Annaiyam Sayi Engal Tandaiyam
lyrics:
Sayi Engal Sadguru (Sayi Engal Deivamam) (2) [ Sayi Engal ]
Allah Yeshu Mahavirum Sathya Sayi Ramanam
Buddha Zohrashtranum Sayi Avataranama
Brahma Vishnu Maheshanum Sathya Sayi Roopamam
Sarva Loka Nayakanam Sathya Sayi Devanam
meaning: Sai is our mother, father, Sadguru, and God. Sai is all of the divine incarnations: Allah, Jesus, Mahavir, Buddha, and Zoroaster.

title: Scatter the seeds of love
title2: Scatter the seeds of love in dreary hearts
lyrics:
And these will sprout into blossoms of love
Which will fill the air with fragrance mmm
Rivers of love will murmur ecstatically through the vales
And every child, bird, beast and pebble will sing the song
Of Love
 
Start the day with Love
Spend the day with Love
End the day with Love, sweet Love
That’s the way to God

title: Schma Israel, Adonai Elohenu
title2: Schma Israel, Adonai Elohenu, Adonai Echod
lyrics:
Kyrie Eleison, Christe Eleison, Adonai Echod
 Allah Hu Akbar, Alhamdulilah, Adonai Echod
 Hear O Israel, the Lord our God, our Lord is One
 Our Holy Father, our Blessed Jesus, our Lord is One
 Our God Resplendent, all Glory to Him, our Lord is One

title: See God In Each Other
lyrics:
Seeing God in my dear old cat
Hearing the sound in a single-handed clap
Glimpsing the Light in a fallen leaf
Sensing Its Presence in the midst of my grief
 
Feeling The One in the smile of a child
Seeing Its Love flowing gentle and mild
Praising God in all that I do
Knowing The Truth that It’s in me and you
 
See God in each other
In a friend, an enemy, a brother
See God in all Its Wonder
See God living as you
 
Feeling The One always close at hand
Grasping a thought that God is who I AM
Touching the hearts of everyone I see
Looking inside being home with me
 
Catching a song that’s coming from within
Giving up lies based on fear and sin
Seeking to know That which sets us free
Releasing it all and coming back to Be
 
See God in each other
In a friend, an enemy, a brother
See God in all Its Wonder
See God living as you
 
Every time I let my heart be open
And I watch God’s Love flow free
I look upon His Creation
And God is all I can see
 
Every time I hear The Voice inside me
Whisper who I AM
I know I’m that child of splendor
With God I walk hand in hand
 
Seeing His Form floating through the crowd
Revealing His Light as He dispels the cloud
Embracing His Love as it captivates my soul
Receiving the faith that I am now made whole
 
Laying my life at the Feet of This One
No longer concerned with what I am to become
Finding it all here in the Presence of Sai
In order to live I must be willing to die
 
See God in each other
In a friend, an enemy, a brother
See God in all Its Wonder
See God living as you

title: Seek ye first the kingdom of God
title2: Seek ye first the kingdom of God, and its righteousness
lyrics:
And all these things shall be added unto you, Allelu Alleluia
 Alleluia Alleluia, Alleluia Allelu Alleluia
 Ask and it shall be given unto you, seek and ye shall find
 Knock and the door shall be opened unto you, Allelu Alleluia
 Alleluia Alleluia, Alleluia Allelu Alleluia
 Senor Shiva, Padre Madre Shiva
 Corazon de azucar, piel azul
 Senor Shiva, Padre Madre Shiva
 Muestra mel camino, tengo que llegar
 Tengo que empesar, tengo que empesar
meaning:
Lord Shiva, You are the Divine Father and Mother. Your heart is as sweet as sugar, and your neck is a
 beautiful blue hue. Show me the path so that I may reach - I must begin the journey

title: Sekai no Kamisama, Uchuu no
title2: Sekai no Kamisama, Uchuu no Kamisama, Subete no Kami Sai Baba
lyrics:
Sai Baba Sai Baba arayuru mono wa hitotsu
Toutoi Kamisama, Uchinaru Kamisama, Subete no Kami Sai Baba
Sai Baba, Sai Baba Watashitachi subete hitotsu
Hahanaru Kamisama, Chichinaru Kamisama, Subete no Kami Sai Baba
meaning: Sai Baba, You are lord of the world and the universe, and everything is one under You. Precious Baba who resides within us, we are all one under You. Sai, You are our mother, our father, and the light that guides us.

title: Señor del sol
title2: Señor del sol, fuente de amor
lyrics:
Señor Shiva, transfórmame, destruye aquello que me impede ver
Señor Shiva, que la verdad sea el camino a la libertad
meaning: Lord of the Sun, source of Love. Lord Shiva, transform me, destroy what prevents me from seeing. Lord Shiva, may the Truth be the way to freedom.

title: Señor Señor Señor Shiva Nataraja
title2: Señor, Señor, Señor, Shiva Nataraja, Señor, Señor, Señor, ...
lyrics:
... Maha Sathya Sai
Shiva Nataraja, Shiva Nataraja, Shiva Nataraja, De Mi Corazon
Danza, Danza, Danza Señor, Al Son Del Tambor, Llename, Llename, ...
... Llename, De Amor
meaning: O Lord Shiva Nataraj, who is none other than the great Lord Sathya Sai, You are dear to my heart. O Lord, dance to the beat of the drums, and fill me with Your Divine Love.

title: Service is Love
title2: Service is love, service is truth, service is God
lyrics:
Service is peace, service is joy, service is God indeed
Sathya Sai, soham
Divine Mother, soham
Divine Father, soham
 
Love is service, love is truth, love is God
Love is peace, love is compassion, love is God indeed
Jesus Christ, soham
Divine Mother, soham
Divine Father, soham
 
Truth is love, truth is peace, truth is God
Truth is service, truth is dharma, truth is God indeed
Shirdi Baba, soham
Divine Mother, soham
Divine Father, soham

title: Set It Free
title2: Set it free, set your spirit flying, flying toward the light,
lyrics:
Set it free, set your spirit flying, flying past the night.
Let me fly, fly beyond the sorrow, far beyond the rain,
Let me fly through the darkest night, until I'm home again.

title: Shaila Girishwara Uma Maheshwara Kashi
title2: Shaila Girishwara Uma Maheshwara Kashi Vishweshwara Sadashiva
lyrics:
Sadashiva Sadashiva
Sadashiva Shambho Sadashiva
meaning: Salutations to Lord Shiva who is the Lord of Kashi (also known as Banares) and the consort of Goddess Uma (Parvathi).

title: Shaktheeshwari Jaya Sayeeshwari Jaya
lyrics:
Kadambari Jaya Kameshwari Jaya [ Shaktheeshwari Jaya ... ]
Partheeshwari Paripalini Jaya Jaya (2)
Manava Roopini Mata Jaya Jaya
meaning: Victory to Mother Sai who is the embodiment of Shakthi, also known by other names such as Kadambari and Kameshwari, the one who is the Lord of Parthi and who protects the Universe.

title: Shakthi Swaroopini Sai Ma (Shiva)
lyrics:
Chidananda Roopini Sai Ma [ Shiva Shakthi ... ]
Bhava Bhaya Harini Sai Ma
Bhakthoddharini Sai Ma
Sai Ma Sathya Sai Ma (2)
meaning: Glory to Mother Sai who is the embodiment of Shakthi who destroys all fears and sorrows, who protects and uplifts Her devotees.

title: Shalom Aleichem Shalom Shalom
title2: Shalom Aleichem Shalom Aleichem Sha*lom Shalom
lyrics: Shalom Aleichem Shalom Aleichem Shalom Shalom
meaning: This Hebrew song means we bring you peace and may be sung as a round.

title: Shambho Mahadeva
lyrics:
Chandrakaladhara Gangadhara
Gowri Vara Shankara
Shiva Shiva Shiva Shambho
Hara Hara Hara Shambho
Hara Gowri (Sathya Sai) Natha Shambho
meaning: Glory to Lord Shiva who is also known as Mahadeva and Shambho, the one who adorns the crescent Moon on His forehead and the sacred river Ganges in His matted locks, the one who is the consort of Gowri (Parvathi).

title: Shambho Mahadeva Gangadhara
lyrics:
Hara Hara Shankara Sadashiva [ Shambho Mahadeva ... ]
Chandrashekara Sayeeshwara
Sayeeshwara
Sayeeshwara Sathya Sayeeshwara [ Chandrashekara ]
Sharanam Sharanam Shiva Shaktheeshwara
meaning: Chant the names Lord Shiva (Also called Shambho, Mahadeva, Shankara and Sadashiva) - the One who adorns the crescent moon on His head and the sacred river Ganges in His Matted Locks. He is none other than the Lord Sai of Parthi.

title: Shambho Mahadeva Gangadhara
lyrics:
Kailasa Vasa Shiva Shankara [ Shambho Mahadeva ... ]
Parvathi Ramana Parameshwara
Parathpara Jagadeeshwara (Partheeshwara)
meaning: Salutations to Lord Shiva Shankara (also known as Mahadeva) who holds the sacred river Ganges in His matted locks, who has made Mount Kailasa His abode, who is Higher than the Highest, the Lord of the Universe and the consort of Goddess Parvathi.

title: Shambho Mahadeva Mallikarjuna
lyrics:
Mangala Charana Trilochana
Pinaka Paani Parvathi Ramana [ Shambho Mahadeva ... ]
Bhava Bhaya Harana Sanathana
Parthi Pureeshwara Patitha Pavana
meaning: Our salutations at the sacred feet of Lord Shiva, (also known as Shambho, Mahadeva and Mallikarjuna) who wields the Bow (Pinaka), who is the consort of Parvathi, who destroys the fear of materialistic world and who is none other than Lord Sai of Parthi.

title: Shambho Mahadeva Shiva Shambho Mahadeva
lyrics:
Hara Haraya Bhava Bhavaya Shiva Shivaya Namah Om
Om Namah Shivaya Om Om Namah Shivaya Om
meaning: Sing the glory of Lord Shiva who is also called Shambho and Mahadeva. He is the one who destroys the fear of the materialistic world.

title: Shambho Mahadeva Shiva Shambho Mahadeva
lyrics:
Samba Sadashiva Sai Shankara Shambho Mahadeva
Hara Hara Hara Shambho Bhava Bhaya Hara Hara Shambho
Shiva Shiva Shiva Shambho Sathya Sayeeshwara Shambho
meaning: Sing the glory of the Lord who is worshipped in the form of Lord Shambho, Mahadeva, Shiva and Shankara.

title: Shambho Murarey Shankara Murarey
lyrics:
Murahara Phani Dhara Shankara Murarey
Shambho Murarey Shankara Murarey [ Murahara Phani ... ]
alt_lyrics:
Shambho Purarey Shankara Purarey
Purahara Phani Dhara Shankara Purarey
Shambho Purarey Shankara Purarey [ Purahara Phani ... ]
meaning: Sing the Glory of Lord Shankara (Shiva), the slayer of the three demons of Tripura and the one who adorns the serpent around His neck.

title: Shambho Nachey Maharaja
lyrics:
Damaru Baajey Nachey Nataraja [ Shambho Nachey ... ]
Om Namah Shivaya Shivaya Namah Om
Hari Om Hari Om Sai Om Sai Om
Hari Om Hari Om [ Hari Om Hari ... ]
meaning: Sing the glory of Lord Shiva (Shambho) who is worshipped in the form of the cosmic dancer Nataraja, the eternal one who dances to the beat of the Damaru (miniature drum). Chant Hari Om and Sai Om.

title: Shambho Shambho Shambho
lyrics:
Shiva Shambho Hara Shambho [ Shambho Shambho ... ]
Neelakantaya Namasthey
Shoola Hastaaya Namasthey
Atma Lingaya Namasthey
Kshema Lingaya Namasthey
Prema Roopaya Namasthey (Sai)
meaning: I bow to You, the blue necked Lord Sai Shiva, who carries a trident and who self-manifests the auspicious Linga. Lord Sai is Love incarnate.

title: Shambho Shambho Shankara Samba Sada
title2: Shambho Shambho Shankara Samba Sada Shiva
lyrics:
Ganga Jatadhara Kanaka Sabesha [ Shambho Shambho ... ]
Kailasa Vasa Hey Paramesha
Shiva Shakthi Roopa Sai Sarvesha (2)
meaning: Glory to Lord of the Lords, Sai who is verily Lord Shiva, who wears the Ganges in His matted hair and who resides at Mount Kailasa. Lord Sai is the embodiment of both Lord Shiva and Shakthi (Mother Parvathi). He is the Lord of all.

title: Shambho Shankara Deva
lyrics:
Bholey (Sai) Baba Mahadeva
Paahi Prabho Sharanam Deva (2) [ Bholey Baba ... ]
Hara Hara Gangey Mahadeva (3)
meaning: Glory to Lord Shiva who bears the Holy river Ganga and who is the Lord of the Lords, Mahadeva. We offer our salutations and surrender to You, O Lord Sai Baba. You are verily the embodiment of Lord Shiva.

title: Shambho Shankara Parvathi Ramana Pashupathi
title2: Shambho Shankara Parvathi Ramana Pashupathi Paramesha
lyrics:
Chandra Chooda Dhara Chandra Kaladhara
Gangadhara Shambho
meaning: Obeisance to Lord Shiva who is also known as Shambho, Shankara and Paramesha. Glory to the one who is the consort of Mother Parvathi,  to the one who is as effulgent as the Moon and who holds the mighty Ganges in His matted locks.

title: Shambho Shankara Sadashiva
lyrics:
Chandrakaladhara Hara Gangadhara [ Shambho Shankara ... ]
Parvathi Ramana Parameshwara
Parameshwara Parameshwara [ Parvathi Ramana ... ]
Parthi Pureesha Prabhu Sayeesha
meaning: Salutations to Lord Sai of Parthi who is none other than Lord Shiva (Shambho, Shankara, Sadashiva). Salutations to the one who holds the crescent Moon on His head and the mighty Ganges in His matted Locks, to the consort of mother Parvathi and to the Lord of the Universe.

title: Shambho Shankara Sai Shiva
lyrics:
Samba Sadashiva Sarvesha
Ganga Jatadhara Shashidhara Shankara
Nithya Lola Kailasa Vasa
meaning: We pray to Lord Shambho Shankara who is also worshipped as Samba Sadashiva. We surrender to the one who holds the mighty Ganges in His matted locks, the one who holds the crescent Moon on His head, the one whose abode is mount Kailasa.

title: Shambho Shankara Samba Sadashiva
lyrics:
Hara Hara Shankara Bhola Maheshwara [ Shambho Shankara … ]
Ganga Jatadhara Natana Manohara
Parthi Pureeshwara Sai Shankara
Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shivaya Namah Om
Hara Hara Hara Hara Haraya Namah Om
meaning: Glory to Lord Shankara (Shiva), the auspicious one who confers prosperity, the one who is eternally blissful, the consort of Amba (Parvathi) and the destroyer of evil traits. Glory to the greatest God who holds the sacred river Ganga in His matted locks and the one who pleased by dance. Salutations to the Lord of Parthi, Lord Sai, who is the verily Lord Shiva.

title: Shambho Shankara Samba Sadashiva
lyrics:
Sai Shankara Shambho Sai Shankara Shambho
Girija Shankara Hara Hara Shiva Shiva [ Sai Shankara ... ]
meaning: Chant the names of Shiva, the beautiful divine dancer who wears the Ganges in His matted hair. Bow to the Supreme Lord Sai who resides in Puttaparthi.

title: Shambho Shankara Samba Sadashiva Sai
title2: Shambho Shankara Samba Sadashiva Sai Mahadeva
lyrics:
Pankaja Lochana Parama Dayalana Sai Mahadeva [ Shambho Shankara ... ]
Ganga Jatadhara Chandrakala Dhara Sai Mahadeva
Shaila Girishwara Shiva Parameshwara Sai Mahadeva
Tumburu Narada Nandi Upasita Sai Mahadeva
Naga Bharana Parvathi Ramana Sai Mahadeva

Jaya Jaya Shankara Hara Hara Shankara (4)
meaning: Praise Lord Sai Shiva, the auspicious one who is called as Mahadeva (the greatest of all the Lords). Lotus-eyed, and merciful, He is adorned with the holy river Ganga and the crescent moon in His matted hair, and serpents around His neck. Parvathi’s Lord residing in the lofty peaks of Himalaya, He is worshipped by sage Narada, Tumburu and Nandi.

title: Shambho Shankara Shiva Shambho Shankara
lyrics:
Shambho Shankara Samba Sadashiva Shambho Shankara
Parthi Nayaka Paramesha Paahi Maam (2) [ Shambho Shankara ... ]
meaning: Salutations to Lord Sai, the Lord of Puttaparthi, who is none other than Lord Shiva also glorified as Shambho, Shankara, Sadashiva and Paramesha.

title: Shambho Shiva Shambho Hara Shambho
title2: Shambho Shiva Shambho Hara Shambho Namah Om
lyrics:
Arunachala Vihara Karuna Dhara Namah Om 
Shambho Natana Shambho Tripura Shambho Namah Om 
Bhava Hara Shiva Nataraja Shekhara
Shaileshwara Mahadeva Shankara
Bhaja Mana Shiva Shambho
meaning: Chant the name of Lord Shiva, who is also known as Shambho, Shekhara, and Hara. Dancing in the Arunachala hill, Shiva is the Lord of the mountains and all three worlds, and He bestows compassion upon all. O Mind, chant the name of Shiva, the Lord of all Lords.

title: Shambho Shiva Shankara
lyrics:
Gangadhara Hara Gowri Shiva [ Shambho Shiva ... ]
Hara Hara Mahadeva Kailasa Vasa
Partheesha Paramesha Paahi Prabho
meaning: Glory to Thee O Lord Sai of Parthi, You are none other than Lord Shiva. You hold the Holy river Ganga on Your matted locks. You are the greatest of Gods and the consort of Mother Gowri (Parvathi). O Supreme Lord whose Holy abode is Mount Kailasa, please protect us.

title: Shambho Shiva Shiva Sundara
lyrics:
Kailasa Vasa Shankara 
Parameshwara Parathpara 
Pralayankara Hey Maheshwara 
Partheesha Sai Sundara 
Karunakara Hey Maheshwara
meaning: Glory to the beautiful Lord Shiva, who resides on Mount Kailasa. He is the Lord of all the cosmos, the Supreme Being who is worshipped as the destroyer. The Lord of compassion, He is none other than our Lord Sathya Sai of Puttaparthi.

title: Shambhu Kumara Gajanana
lyrics:
Shankari Tanaya Gajanana
Ambika Tanaya Gajanana
Ambuja Lochana Gajanana
meaning: Salutations to Lord Gajanana son of Lord Shiva (Shambho) and Mother Parvathi (Shankari, Ambika). His eyes are of the shape of Lotus.

title: Shambhu Kumara Gowri Tanaya
lyrics:
Gajanana Sadaya Jaya Jaya
Varada Ganesha Duritha Vinasha
Pranavakaara Natha Sadaya [ Gajanana Sadaya ... ]
meaning: Salutations to Lord Ganesha, the son of Lord Shiva (Shambhu) and Mother Parvathi (Gowri), the one who grants boons, destroys obstacles and who is personification of the Primordial sound "Om".

title: Shambhu Kumara Haro Hara
lyrics:
Shiva Shankari Bala Haro Hara
Uma Sutha Shanmukha Guha
Shiva Sharavana Bhava Haro Hara
Pazhani Girisha Haro Hara Puttaparthi Pureesha Haro Hara
Hara Hara Hara Hara Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva [ Shiva Sharavana ... ]
meaning: Worship Lord Karthikeya residing on the hills of Pazhani, the son of Lord Shiva and Mother Parvathi. He is none other than Lord Sai whose abode is Puttaparthi.

title: Shankara Abhayankara
lyrics:
Daya Nidhey Manohara [ Shankara ... ]
Saama Gaana Priyakara
Sai Jaga Vandana
Parameshwara Maheshwara
Sabha Pathey (Krupa Nidhey) Manohara
meaning: Glory to Lord Shankara who dispels all fears, the one who is the ocean of mercy, the one who is most beautiful and the one who loves music. We offer our salutations to the Lord of the Universe, Lord Sai.

title: Shankara Naam Bhajo
lyrics:
Shankara Shankara Naam Bhajo (3) [ Shankara Naam ... ]
Peetambara Dhara Sai Shankara
Chandrakala Dhara Gowri Manohara
meaning: Chant the name of Lord Shankara (Shiva) the consort of Gowri. Lord Sai, the one who adorns the yellow dress (Peetambara) is verily Lord Shiva who has the crescent Moon on the head.

title: Shankara Roopa Sajjana Vanditha
title2: Shankara Roopa Sajjana Vanditha Sai Rama Namosthuthey
lyrics:
Raghupathi Roopa Ramya Charitha Sai Rama Namosthuthey
Keshava Roopa Klesha Vinashaka Sai Rama Namosthuthey
Adbhuta Charitha Anjaneya Anatha Rakshaka Namosthuthey
Sarvaadhara Sadhu Janavana Sai Rama Namosthuthey
Nirvikara Nirupama Charitha Sai Rama Namosthuthey
Jaya Sai Rama Namosthuthey
meaning: We sing in praise of Lord Sai Rama who is the embodiment of Lord Shankara and who is worshipped by all noble beings. He is the embodiment of Lord Rama who has unblemished character. He is the embodiment of Lord Keshava(Krishna) who destroys all the obstacles and the one who is the Lord of Hanuman who is the protector of all beings. We offer our salutations to You Oh Lord Sai Rama, the protector of the Universe and the one adored by the saints and the one who is worshipped as the Formless one.

title: Shankara Sadashiva Chandrashekara
lyrics:
Chandrashekara (Sathya) Sai Shankara [ Shankara Sadashiva ... ]
Neelakanta Shooladhari Sai Shankara
Phaala Netra Tripura Haari Sai Shankara [ Chandrashekara ... ]
meaning: Obeisance to Lord Sai who is none other than Lord Shankara (Shiva), the one who holds the crescent moon on His head. He is also known as Neelakanta, as His throat is blue in color (due to the poison He swallowed during the conflict between Gods and demons). Salutations to the one who holds the Trident and who has the Third Eye on His forehead and who slayed the demon Tripura.

title: Shankara Sadashiva Sabha Pathey Manohara
lyrics:
Chandrashekara Jatadhara Uma Maheshwara [ Shankara ... ]
Shankara Sai Shankara (2)
Eshwara Sayeeshwara (Partheeshwara) [ Chandrashekara ... ]
meaning: Salutations to Lord Shankara (Shiva) the master of stage, the one who holds the crescent moon in His matted hair. We offer our humble salutations to the consort of Goddess Uma (Parvathi). Lord Shiva is none other than Lord Sai of Puttaparthi.

title: Shankara Sadashiva Shiva Shiva Shambho
lyrics:
Chandrashekara Hara Hara Hara Shambho [ Shankara Sadashiva ... ]
Bhasma Bhooshitanga Sai Shiva Shiva Shambho
Bala Shashi Vibhushana Hara Hara Shambho
Omkara Roopa Sai Shiva Shiva Shambho
Om Namah Shivaya Hara Hara Shambho

Om Namah Shivaya (4)
meaning: Chant the name of Lord Shiva, who is adorned with sacred ash and has crescent of moon on His head, who is the Primordial "Om" personified.

title: Shankara Samba Shiva Hara Hara
lyrics:
Shankara Samba Shiva [ Shankara Samba ... ]
Ganga Jatadhara Gowri Mahesha
Chandra Kaladhara Hey Paramesha
Kailasa Vasa Kashi Pathey
Karuna Sagara Gowri (Parthi) Pathey
meaning: Glory to Lord Shankara (Shiva), the one who holds the mighty Ganges in His Locks, the one adorned with the crescent moon, the consort of Gowri and the Lord of Kashi (the city of Banaras where He is adored as Lord Viswanath). O Sai, the Lord of Parthi, You are verily Lord Shiva, You are the ocean of compassion and mercy. We pray and offer our salutations to You.

title: Shankara Shankara
lyrics:
Sai Shankara
Naada Shareera Vedodhara
Kali Yuga Avatara Sai
Hara Shiva Shankara Sai Shiva Shiva Shankara Sai
Chandrashekara Sai Parthi Shankara Sai
meaning: Glory to Lord Sai Shankara who is the embodiment of Music and the Vedas and who has taken the form of Sai in this age of Kali. O Lord Sai, we hail victory to You and offer our salutations to You.

title: Shankara Shankara
lyrics:
Shambho Shankara Sayeeshwara [ Shankara ... ]
Ganga Jatadhara Shankara
Gowri Manohara Shankara
Shankara Shankara
Girija Ramana Shiva Shambho
Hara Hara Hara Hara Hara Shambho
meaning: Glory to Lord Shankara who holds the mighty Ganges in His Matted Locks, who is the consort of Mother Gowri (Girija).

title: Shankara Shankara
lyrics:
Shankari Manohara
Parvathi Nayaka
Paahi Gangadhara
Pankaja Lochana
Pannaga Bhooshana
Chandrabimba Mukha
Chandrashekara Harey
Jai Jai Shankara Hara Hara Shankara (6)
meaning: Glory to Lord Shankara, the consort of Mother Shankari (Parvathi) and the One who holds the Ganges in His Locks, who is as beautiful as the Moon and has Lotus eyes, who adorns serpents as ornaments and who holds the crescent Moon, We pray and offer our salutations to Thee.

title: Shankara Shankara Chandrashekara
lyrics:
Chandramouli Shankara Shambho Shankara (2)
Ganga Jatadhara Gowri Shankara
Paapa Vimochana Shashi Shekara
Lingodhbhavakara Sai Shankara
Parthi Puri Shankara Shambho Shankara (2)
meaning: Salutations to Lord Shankara (also known as Chandramouli and Shambho) the one who holds the Ganges in His Locks, the one who is worshipped as the consort of Mother Gowri, the one who holds the crescent Moon on His head and to the Sai Shankara who creates the sacred Lingam.

title: Shankara Shankara Chandrashekara
lyrics:
Hara Hara Hara Shiva Shiva Shiva Chandrashekara [ Shankara ... ]
Neelakanta Shooladhari Chandrashekara
Brihadheeshwara Shaileshwara Chandrashekara
Shirdeeshwara Partheeshwara Sayeeshwara
Bhuvaneshwara Hrudayeshwara Sayeeshwara
meaning: Glory to Lord Shankara (shiva), the blue-throated one who is adorned with the crescent moon on His head and who wields the Trident. He is hailed as Lord Brihadheeshwara in Tanjore and as Shaileshwara, the Lord of the mountains. He is verily our Lord Sai of Shirdi and Puttaparthi. He is the master of this universe as well as our hearts.

title: Shankara Shankara Sadashiva
lyrics:
Sadashiva Hey Samba Shiva [ Shankara ... ]
Amba Sahita Samba Shiva
Samba Shiva Hey Sadashiva
meaning: Pray to the ever blissfull Lord Shankara (Shiva) who is always with Mother Amba (Parvathi).

title: Shankara Shankara Sai Shankara Jaya
title2: Shankara Shankara Sai Shankara Jaya Jaya Jaya Shiva Om
lyrics:
Jaya Jaya Jaya Shiva (Shiva Sai) Om
Shirdi Mahesha Shiva Paramesha Jaya Jaya Jaya Shiva Om
Jaya Jaya Shiva Sai Om
Parthi Mahesha Pranavakaara Jaya Jaya Jaya Shiva Om
Jaya Jaya Jaya Shiva (Shiva Sai) Om
Jaya Jaya Jaya Shiva ( Sai ) Om (3)
Shiva Om Sai Om (2)
meaning: Chant the name of Lord Shankara (Shiva) who is none other than Lord Sai, Lord of Shirdi and Parthi, the very embodiment of the Primordial Sound 'Om'.

title: Shankara Shankara Samba Sadashiva
title2: Shankara Shankara Samba Sadashiva Shankara Shankara Shambho
lyrics:
Chandrakaladhara Shankara Ganga Jatadhara Shankara [ Shankara Shankara ... ]
Kailasa Vasa Shankara Trishoola Dhari Shankara
Shivaya Bhavaya
Shiva Bhava Hara Chandrashekhara
meaning: Glory to Lord Shiva, the most auspicious one who is adorned with the crescent moon and who bears the Holy Ganges on His head. He is the resident of Mount Kailasa, wields a Trident and destroys the fear of the materialistic world.

title: Shankara Shankara Samba Shiva
lyrics:
Samba Sadashiva Sai Shiva [ Shankara ... ]
Chandramouli Sadashiva
Sadguru Sathya Sai Shiva
meaning: Salutations to You Oh Lord Shankara (also known as Samba Shiva) who is worshipped as Sadashiva and Chandramouli we offer our salutations to you Oh Lord and universal Preceptor Sathya Sai Shiva.

title: Shankara Shankara Shankara
lyrics:
Shankara Abhayankara
Paahi Maam Krupakara
Paahi Maam Sayeeshwara
meaning: We seek your protection Oh Lord Sai who in the form of Lord Shankara gives succor to all.

title: Shankara Shankara Shankara Shankara Shambho
title2: Shankara Shankara Shankara Shankara Shambho Shankara
lyrics:
Shiva Shambho Hara Shambho Shiva Shiva Hara Shambho
Shiva Shambho Hara Shambho
Shambho Shankara Sayeesha
Trishoola Dhari Trinetra Dhari [ Shiva Shambho ... ]
meaning: Salutations to Lord Sai who is none other than Lord Shiva (Shankara), the one who is armed with the Trident and with the third eye on His forehead.

title: Shankara Shankara Shankara Shiva Shambho
lyrics: Shiva Shambho Shiva Shambho Shiva Shambho Shiva Shambho (2)
meaning: This song is in praise of Lord Shiva, who is the verily auspiciousness.

title: Shankara Shiva Shankara Shiva Shankara
title2: Shankara Shiva Shankara Shiva Shankara Roopa Maheshwara Sai
lyrics:
Shankara Shankara Shankara Sai
Omkara Priya Shiva Shankara Sai
Kailasa Priya Shiva Shankara Sai
Nata Jana Priya Shiva Shankara Sai [ Shankara Shankara ]
meaning: Salutations to You Oh Sai who is the embodiment of Lord Shiva (with other names like Shankara and Maheshwara), the one who is worshipped as the  personification of Primordial "Om", the one who is dear to the devotees and whose abode is the Holy mountains of Kailasa.

title: Shankara Shiva Shankara Shiva Shankara
title2: Shankara Shiva Shankara Shiva Shankara Sai Shankar
lyrics:
Parthi Ke Tum Ho Nivasi
Kailash Ke Tum Ho Nivasi [ Shankara Shiva ... ]
Shankara Roop Se Tum Ne Aaya Gangadhari Tum Ho Swami
Gangadhari Tum Ho Sai
meaning: O Lord Sai, Your Divine abodes are Puttaparthi and Kailasa, You are the Form of Lord Shiva (Shankara) who holds the river Ganges on Your head. Glory be to Thee O Lord Sai.

title: Shankara Shiva Shankara Shiva Shankara
title2: Shankara Shiva Shankara Shiva Shankara Shambho
lyrics:
Shankara Shiva Shankara Shiva Shambho Mahadeva [ Shankara ... ]
Dama Dama Damaru Bajey Shankara Ghana Ghana Ghanta Bajey
(Hara) Hara Bholey Natha Shambho Hara Sai Natha Shambho
meaning: Salutations to Lord Shankara, also known as Shiva and Shambho who dances to the sound of Damaru (the miniature drum in His hand) and the ringing of bells. Chant the name of Sai Natha who is verily Lord Shiva.

title: Shankaram Bhajey Shankaram Bhajey
lyrics:
Parthi Vasa Sai Deva Shankaram Bhajey
Sadgurum Bhajey Sadgurum Bhajey
Satchidananda Guru Sadgurum Bhajey
alt_lyrics:
Shankaram Bhajey Shankaram Bhajey
Parthi Vasa Sai Deva Shankaram Bhajey
Sadgurum Bhajey Sadgurum Bhajey
Parthi Vasa Sai Deva Sadgurum Bhajey
meaning: Chant the name of Lord Sai who resides at Parthi, who is none other than Lord Shankara (Shiva). Chant the name of the Universal Preceptor who is the very embodiment of bliss.

title: Shankaraya Namah Shivaya
lyrics:
Sadashivaya Namah Shivaya [ Shankaraya ... ]
Uma Varaya Namah Shivaya
Omkaraya Namah Shivaya (2)
Om Namah Shivaya Shivaya Namah Om (4)
meaning: Salutations to Lord Shankara (Shiva) who is the consort of Mother Uma (Parvathi). Salutations to Lord Shiva who is the embodiment of the Primordial Sound "Om".

title: Shankari Bhaktha Vashankari Ma
lyrics:
Sankata Haarini Sai Ma
Pranava Swaroopini Prema Dayini
Parthi Pureeshwari Palaya Maam
Mangala Kaarini Manjula Bhaashini
Gnana Dayini Sai Ma
Sai Ma (Sathya) Sai Ma
meaning: Salutations to Mother Shankari (Parvathi), who is the remover of obstacles, who is verily Mother Sai, the embodiment of the Primordial Sound Om. Protect us O Lord of Parthi, the bestower of love, wisdom and auspiciousness.

title: Shankha Chakra Dhara Sai Krishna
lyrics:
Shyamala Komala Murali Krishna [ Shankha ... ]
Radha Lola Raasa Vilola
Ranga Ranga Ranga Vittala
Vittala Vittala Sai Ranga Vittala (2)
meaning: Salutations to Lord Krishna who is the beloved of Radha. He is dark complexioned and soft natured, with a Conch and Disc in each hand. He is none other than Sai who is also Vittala.

title: Shankha Chakra Peetambara Dhari
title2: Shankha Chakra Peetambara Dhari Karuna Sagara Rama Murari
lyrics:
Shankha Chakra Peetambara Dhari Karuna Sagara Krishna Murari
Shankha Chakra Peetambara Dhari Karuna Sagara Sai Murari
meaning: Glory to Lord Narayana, who bears the Conch and the Discus, who wears yellow silk and who incarnated as the ever merciful Lord Rama, Krishna and Sai.

title: Shanmukha Natha Shanmukha Natha
lyrics:
Om Saravana Bhava Shanmukha Natha Guru Saravana Bhava Shanmukha Natha
Shanmukha Natha Shanmukha Natha
meaning: We take refuge in Lord Shankmukha (Subrahmanya), the Lord who has six faces and who is glorified as Sharavana.

title: Shanmukha Shanmukha Sai Sundara
lyrics:
Shiva (Guru) Sharavana Bhava Om
Mangala Gowri Shankara Nandana [ Shiva (Guru) ... ]
Parthi Vihari Pranavakaari [ Shiva (Guru) ... ]
meaning: Glory to Lord Sai who resides in Parthi and who is the personification of the primordial sound "Om", who is worshipped as Lord Shanmukha and as the Guru, who is the blessed son of Mother Gowri and Lord Shankara.

title: Shantha Durge Shanthi Swaroopini
lyrics:
Shyamala Komala Mana Mohini [ Shantha Durge ... ]
Adi Anadi Anantha Swaroopini
Moksha Pradayini Narayani (2)
alt_lyrics:
Shantha Durge Shanthi Swaroopini
Shyamala Komala Mana Mohini [ Shantha Durge ... ]
Mangala Dayini Madhura Vani
Gita Vinodini Sai Janani
meaning: This song extols Mother Durga who has a peaceful appearance, attractive dark complexioned soft features, who is the embodiment of a form that is all pervading without beginning and end and the one who liberates us from the cycle of birth and death.

title: Shanthi Pradayini Ma Jaya Ma
title2: Shanthi Pradayini Ma Jaya Ma Janani
lyrics:
Sundara Roopini Ma Jaya Ma Janani [ Shanthi Pradayini Ma ... ]
Santaapa Haarini Samprapya Dayini
Ma Bhuvaneshwari Janani
(Jaya) Ma Hrudayeshwari Janani
Jaya Ma Janani (2)
meaning: Glory to the Divine Mother, who is the bestower of ultimate, Divine peace. She removes all difficulties and gives prosperity to Her devotees. She is the eternal resident of the entire universe, and of our hearts.

title: Sharadey Hey Sukha Paani
lyrics:
Bharati Janani Bhagya Vidayini [ Sharadey Hey ... ]
Mangala Dayini Madhura Vani
Geeta Vinodini Sai Janani
meaning: Sing the praises of Mother Saraswati, the Goddess of knowledge, whose speech is sweet, auspicious, who bestows fortune and who is the creator of enchanting music. Mother Sai is none other than Goddess Saraswati.

title: Sharadey Jaya Sharadey Vaagvilasini Sharadey
lyrics:
Sharadey Jaya Sharadey Vidya Dayini Sharadey
Sharadey Jaya Sharadey Veda Mata Sharadey
Veda Mata Sharadey
meaning: Victory to Mother Sharada (Saraswathi) who resides in our speech, who is the embodiment of knowledge and who is the mother of all Vedas.

title: Sharana Bina Shanthi Nahin
lyrics:
Shankara Sai Shankara
Naama Bina Paramananda Nahin
Naama Bhajorey Namah Shivaya
Om Namah Shivaya Shivaya Namah Om (3)
meaning: There is no peace (of mind) without surrendering at the lotus feet of Lord Shiva. There is no supreme happiness without reciting the name of Lord Sai or bowing to Him who is verily Lord Shiva.

title: Sharanagatha Sai Paapa Haro
lyrics:
Sadguru Eshwara Kalpataru [ Sharanagatha Sai ... ]
Deena Bandhava Tum Bhakton Ke
Abhaya Pradayaka Daasa Janon Ke (2)
meaning: Surrender to Lord Sai and be rid of your sins. He is the Supreme teacher and Lord who protects His devotees and fulfills their wishes.

title: Sharanam Guru Deva
lyrics:
Sharanam Sai Deva [ Sharanam ... ]
Mata Pitha Guru Deva
Bandhu Sakha Sai Deva
Sab Ka Malik Sai Deva
Satchidananda Guru Sai Deva
meaning: Surrender to Sai who is our Preceptor, Mother, Father, Friend and Relation. He is the Lord of all Faiths, He is Being (Sath), Awareness (Chith) and Bliss (Ananda).

title: Sharanam Sharanam Paahi Gajananam
lyrics:
Vighna Vinashaka Gananatham
Buddhi Pradayaka Paahi Gajananam
Asura Nikhandana Paahi Gajananam
Paahi Gajananam Paahi Gajananam [ Vighna Vinashaka ... ]
meaning: Surrender to Lord Gajanana, who removes and destroys all obstacles in our path to salvation, the one who bestows wisdom, the one who destroys all the demonic qualities within us.

title: Sharanam Sharanam Sayeesha Sharanam
lyrics:
Sri Guru Mama Guru Sadguru Sai Guru [ Sharanam Sharanam ... ]
Parthi Pureeshwara Sai Gopalam
Shanthi Nivasam Guru Deva Sharanam (Pra)
meaning: Surrender to our Lord Sai who is our Divine Preceptor and whose abode is Prashanthi Nilayam in Parthi.

title: Sharavana Bhava Guha Shiva Shakthi
title2: Sharavana Bhava Guha Shiva Shakthi Bala
lyrics:
Shanmukha Natha Vadivela
Kanda Kumara Karthikeya
Subrahmanya Deva Sai Bhagawan
meaning: Sharavana is another name for Shiva and Parvathi's son who is also called, Shanmukha, Muruga, Kanda, Kumara, Karthikeya and Subrahmanya Deva. He is none other than Lord Sai.

title: Sharavana Bhava Sri Shanmukha Natha
lyrics:
Hara Hara Hara Hara Haro Hara
Gowri Nandana Haro Hara
Gangadhara Sutha Haro Hara
Pazhani Girisha Parthi Pureesha
Sai Natha Haro Hara (3)
meaning: This song is in praise of Lord Shanmukha (also called Muruga, Kumara), the son of Lord Shiva and Parvathi. His abode is on top of the Pazhani Hills. Lord Sai of Puttaparthi is verily Lord Shanmukha. Our humble obeisance to Him.

title: Sharavana Bhavaney Shanmukha
lyrics:
Velayuda Vel Muruga [ Sharavana Bhavaney ... ]
Valli Natha Karthikeya
Karuna Sagara Kumara Guruvara
Mayura Vahana Muruga Natha
Sharanam Sharanam Parthi (Sai) Natha
Sharanam Sharanam Muruga (Sai) Natha (5)
alt_lyrics:
Sharavana Bhavaney Shanmukha
Velayuda Vel Muruga [ Sharavana Bhavaney ... ]
Valli Natha Karthikeya
Karuna Sagara Kumara Guruvara
Mayura Vahana Muruga Natha
Sharanam Sharanam Arumuga
meaning: This song is in praise of Lord Shanmukha (also called Muruga, Kumara), the son of Lord Shiva and Parvathi. He is extolled as the one who is armed with divine Spear and accompanied by His consort Valli. We seek the blessings of the compassionate Lord Muruga riding on the peacock. Our salutations to Lord Sai Natha who is none other than Shanmukha.

title: Share, Share, Share
Shata Baar Kaho Rey Sai
title2: Shata Baar Kaho Rey Sai Ram Sai Ram Sai Ram Sai Ram
lyrics:
Hey Mangala Nayana Ram Hey Gopi Jeevana Shyam
Hey Shirdi Ke Bhagawan Hey Prashanthi Nilaya Ram
Shata Koti Namana Sai Ram
Sai Ram Sai Ram Sai Ram
meaning: Our innumerable salutations to Lord Sai Ram, the one whose look is the most auspicious and the one who is the very life of the Gopikas. He is the Lord of Shirdi and the one who resides at Prashanthi Nilayam in Puttaparthi. Let us chant His name million times.

title: Shata Koti Pranam Sai Ram
title2: Shata Koti Pranam Sai Ram Sai Ram Sai Ram Sai Ram
lyrics:
Paapa Vimochana Ram Sai Ram Sai Ram Sai Ram
Hey Mangala Pavana Naam Sai Ram Sai Ram Sai Ram
Man Mandir Hey Tera Dham Sai Ram Sai Ram Sai Ram
Sai Ram Sai Ram Sai Ram (4)
meaning: We offer our million salutations to You, O Lord Sai, You are the one who destroys all our sins, whose name is the most beautiful and auspicious. Lord Sai resides in our hearts.

title: Sheetala Charanam Komala Charanam
title2: Sheetala Charanam Komala Charanam, Manjula Charanam Mama Guru Charanam
lyrics:
Mrudula Charanam Anugraha Charanam
Sadguru Charanam Sada Smarami
Prema Daata Sai Guru Natha
Pavana Charanam Sada Bhajami
meaning: The Feet of my Divine Preceptor Sai are cold and soft, are tender to touch and are full of grace. Let us all meditate and offer our prayers to these holy Feet, which always shower love and grace.

title: Shesha Sai Narayana
lyrics:
Vasudeva Narayana
Paasha Nashana Narayana
Narayana Hari (Sathya) Narayana
Narayana Hari ( Sai ) Narayana (3)
meaning: Salutations to Lord Narayana who is worshipped as Sesha Sai, Vasudeva, Hari and Lord Sathya Narayana who destroys all our sins.

title: Shesha Shaila Vasa Narayana
lyrics:
Bhaktha Parijata Narayana [ Shesha Shaila ... ]
Sarva Jeeva Vasa Narayana
Saama Gaana Lola Narayana
Sathya Sai Roopa Narayana (Hey)
meaning: Salutations to Lord Narayana who is reclining on the Celestial Serpent Adi Sesha. O Lord, You are the ever-pleasing Parijata flower for Your devotees, the indweller of all beings. You foster the Saama Veda which is the basis of music. O Lord Sathya Sai, You are none other than Lord Narayana.

title: Shifuku no Umi yo
title2: Shifuku no Umi yo Fue wo Kanade
lyrics:
Subete no Kokoro wo Toraeru Krishna
 Watashi no Kokoro wo Fue ni Tatoete
 Anata no Ai wo Kanade tamae
meaning: Lord Krishna, who has captured our hearts, play Your flute and spread Your ocean of love and bliss.

title: Shine On
title2: Let Your light shine down on me
lyrics:
By Your love we all shall see
Hands that heal are meant for sharing
Touching souls through lives of caring.
 
Shine on (Shine on)
Shine on
Shine on (Shine on)
Shine on
 
When will people understand
That fear alone divides our land
How much further must we fall
Before people rise and answer Your call [ Shine on ... ]
 
Shine on...so sweet
Your love...
Your love complete
Shine on…
Your hand in mine
Together...till the end of time  [ Shine on ... ]

Will we see the truth revealed
As the planet cries out and the fire is real
Heal our hearts and break these chains
And let God's Grace pour down like rain  [ Shine on ... ]
 
Take Your children by the hand
And lead us to that Promised Land
Guide our steps with faith and love
And light our path from Heaven above [ Shine on ... ]
 
Shine on...so sweet
Your love... Your love complete
Shine on…
Your hand in mine
Together...till the end of time [ Shine on ... ]
 
You have woven our lives together (Shine on...)
Every thread shall live forever (Shine on...)
Cover us with Your mantle of peace (Shine on...)
And by Your love we are released. (Shine on...)
Shine on...

title: Shinri no Kaze wo Uke
title2: Shinri no Kaze wo Uke Ai no Utagoe to tomoni
lyrics:
Yuuki no Unabara wo Wataraseta mou, Shiva no Miko Gajavadana
Ganesha Sharanam, Ganesha Sharanam (3)
Ganesha Ganesha Ganesha Sharanam

Gowri Ganesha Shambho Ganesha
Shirdi Ganesha Parthi Ganesha
Gowri Ganesha Shambho Ganesha
Shirdi Ganesha Parthi (Sathya Sai) Ganesha
meaning: Receive the winds of truth and the songs of love given to us by Lord Ganesha. You allow us to cross the oceans of courage, O son of Shiva.

title: Shirdi Ke Bhagawan Sai Ram
lyrics:
Parthi Mey Tum Janam Liyo Rey [ Shirdi Ke ... ]
Mandir Mandir Ghanta Baajey
Terey Hi Naam Ki Mahima Gaayen
Bhakthon Ke Rakhwaley Gopala
meaning: Oh Lord of Shirdi, you have incarnated in Parthi. Every temple and religious place is ringing the bells in praise of you and your name, Oh Lord Gopala you are the protector of the devotees.

title: Shirdi Ke Sai Parthi Ke
title2: Shirdi Ke Sai Parthi Ke Baba
lyrics:
Tum Ho Hamarey Pyaarey Sai Baba [ Shirdi Ke ... ]
Premamaya Sai Prema Pradatha
Eshwaramba Nandana Jagat Paripala
Paapa Vinashaka Parama Krupala
meaning: O Lord Sai, Shirdi and Parthi are Your abodes. You are our loving Sai Baba. You are embodiment of Love and the bestower of Love. O the compassionate Son of Mother Eshwaramba, You are the sustainer of this entire Universe. O Lord, please annihilate our sins.

title: Shirdi Mahadeva Deva Shirdi Mahadeva
lyrics:
Shanthi Prema Sadguru Natha
Shirdi Puri Natha (Vasa) Deva
Shirdi Ke Sai Natha Sadguru Natha
Parthi Ke Sai Deva Sadguru Deva
Gurudev Gurudev Gurudev Gurudev (4)
meaning: Glory to the Divine Preceptor Sai of Shirdi and Puttaparthi, who is the Supreme Lord and is the very embodiment of Love and Peace.

title: Shirdi Mahesha Shiva Shankara
lyrics:
Parthi Pureesha Parameshwara
Shankara Shiva Shankara Sai Shankara
Shiva (4) Shivaya Namah Om
Hara (4) Haraya Namah Om
Shivaya Namah Om Haraya Namah Om (2)
meaning: Salutations to Lord Sai who resides in Shirdi and Parthi. He is verily Lord Shankara (Shiva), the Lord of the Lords. Chant the name of Lord Shiva.

title: Shirdi Mandir Se Aao
title2: Shirdi Mandir Se Aao Merey Sai
lyrics:
Hrudaya Mandir Mey Bas Rahjao Sai
Tum Ho Merey Mata Pitha Deena Rakshaka
Tum Ho Merey Bandhu Sakha Prana Nayaka
Tum Ho Merey Jeevan Ka Aadhar Baba
Daya Karo Krupa Karo Parthi Nivasa

Shirdi Mandir Se Aao Merey Sai
Parthipuri Se Aao Sathya Sai
Prema Shanthi Sabko Deejo Merey Sai
Aao Merey Sai Aao Merey Sai
meaning:
Please come from Your abode at Shirdi, O my Lord Sai, and install Thyself in the temple of our hearts. O Protector of the forlorn, You are our mother, father, kin and friend. You are the Master of the vital forces and the very basis of our lives. Please bestow Your compassion on us, O resident of Parthi.

O Lord Sai, come from the temple at Shirdi. O Lord Sathya Sai, please come from the Holy place of Puttaparthi and bestow Love and Peace on all.

title: Shirdi Nivasa Sai Shankara
lyrics:
Parthi Nivasa Sai Shankara
Bhaavatheetha Bhaava Gochara
Kaalatheetha Kaala Bhairava
Jai Jagadeeshwara Omkareshwara (5)
meaning: Glory to Lord Sai Shankara who is the embodiment of Shirdi Baba and Parthi Baba, and who is beyond time and imagination. Victory to Lord Sai, the Lord of the world and who is the very embodiment of Om.

title: Shirdi Sai Bhajana Karo
lyrics:
Sathya Sai Bhajana Karo (2)
Prema Sai Bhajana Karo
Narayana Bhajana Karo
meaning: Come one and all and sing the Glory of Lord Shirdi Sai, Lord Prema Sai, Lord Sathya Sai and Lord Narayana.

title: Shirdi Sai Dwarakamayi
lyrics:
Tum Ho Merey Bhagawan
Tum Ho Sai Bhagawan
Sab Bhakto Ke Tum Ho Daata
Sab Ko Hai Tum Prana Daata
Ananda Daata Hey Sukha Daata [ Tum Ho ... Sai Bhagawan ]
meaning: Lord Sai of Shirdi who resides in Dwarakamayi is my Lord and the Lord of all devotees. He bestows happiness and comfort to all and is their very life-breath.

title: Shirdi Sai Dwarakamayi Jai Jai
title2: Shirdi Sai Dwarakamayi Jai Jai Ho Sathya Sai Ram
lyrics:
Sai Ram Sai Ram
Jai Jai Ho Sathya (Parthi Pureeshwara) Sai Ram
meaning: Glory and salutations to Lord Sai of Shirdi and Lord Sathya Sai of Puttaparthi.

title: Shirdi Sai Dwarakamayi Prashanthi Vasi
title2: Shirdi Sai Dwarakamayi Prashanthi Vasi Sai Ram
lyrics:
Sai Ram Sai Ram Ek Naam Sundara Naam [ Shirdi Sai ... ]
Allah Eshwara Sai Ram
Parthipuri Ke Hey Bhagawan
Daya Karo Krupa Karo Raksha Karo Hey Bhagawan [ Sai Ram ... ]
meaning: Salutations to Lord Shirdi Baba, the Lord of Dwarakamayi and to the Lord of Prashanthi, Sai Ram, the name so enthralling. He is none other than Allah and Eshwar (Shiva) and the Lord of Parthi. O Lord show mercy and protect us.

title: Shirdi Sai Hey Bhagawan
lyrics:
Uddhara Karo Bhagawan
Janam Maran Se Paar Karo Tum Sai Natha Bhagawan
Bhava Bandhan Se Door Karo Tum Deena Natha Bhagawan
Daya Karo Bhagawan (Mujhey)
meaning: Glory to Lord Shirdi Sai, We plead You to redeem us from this world, take us from this bondage of birth and death and from the bondage of emotion, sorrow and attachment, Oh Lord Sai Natha.

title: Shirdi Sai Pandarpura Parthipura Pandarpura
lyrics:
Parabrahma Sakshath Hai Sathya Sai Vittala Vittala [ Shirdi Sai ... ]
Baktha Sakha Panduranga Deena Sakha Sai Ranga (2)
Sri Hari Vittala Jaya Hari Vittala (3)
Vittala Vittala Jaya Hari Vittala
meaning: Lord Sai of Shirdi and Parthi is verily Lord Vittala of Pandharpur. O Lord Sathya Sai, You are the Supreme Lord, the sole protector of the devotees and the downtrodden. Victory to Lord Vittala.

title: Shirdi Sai Parthi Baba
lyrics:
Deena Janon Ke Sai Bhaktha Janon Ke Baba
Kali Yuga Avatara Merey Jeevan Aadhara
Sri Guru Sai Ram Sadguru Sai Ram
meaning: Glory to Lord Shirdi Sai who is now in the form of Parthi Baba, the protector of His devotees as well as the weak and the downtrodden, He has incarnated in this Kali age to sustain and protect all beings. We offer our salutations to You, O Lord Sai, You are our divine Preceptor.

title: Shirdi Sai Parthi Sai Hum
title2: Shirdi Sai Parthi Sai Hum Ko Deejo Premamrutha Dhara Premamrutha Dhara
lyrics:
Tava Seva Ki Avasar Deejo Sathya Sai Mahadev
Ganamrutha Mey Bhaav Bhi Deejo Prema Sai Bhagawan Prema Sai Bhagawan
meaning: O Lord Sai of Shirdi and Puttaparthi, please let the perennial stream of Love flow from You to us, O Lord Sathya Sai, please provide us the opportunity to serve You, O Lord Prema Sai, please instill the devotion and Love whenever we sing Your  Glorious Name.

title: Shirdi Sai Parthi Sai, Both Names
title2: Shirdi Sai Parthi Sai, both names are one, give us all endless flow of Love, give us all endless flow of Love
lyrics:
That’s why we serve all, with love and gratitude to Sathya Sai, our great Lord
Grant us more sweet Love, with delightful Joy, Prema Sai is the One, Prema Sai is the One

title: Shirdi Sai Shankara Parthi Vihari
title2: Shirdi Sai Shankara Parthi Vihari Shankara
lyrics:
Shankara Abhayankara Bhava Bhaya Haari Shankara [ Shirdi Sai ... ]
Paramatma Shiva Shankara Pavana Purusha Shankara
Sathya Swaroopa Shankara Sathya Sai Shankara
meaning: Obeisance to Lord Sai of Shirdi who has now incarnated at Parthi. He is the embodiment of Lord Shankara (Shiva). O Lord who is all pervading, the most auspicious and sacred, who removes all fear, we offer our humble salutations.

title: Shirdi Sai Vittala Shesha Sai
title2: Shirdi Sai Vittala Shesha Sai Vittala
lyrics:
Sri Ranga Vittala Rakumayi Vittala
Jaya Jaya Vittala Jaya Sai Vittala
Hey Ranga Vittala Panduranga Vittala
meaning: This song extols the Glory and the attributes of Lord Panduranga Vittala (another name for Lord Krishna) of Pandharpur. He is none other than the Shirdi Sai who as Vishnu was reclining on the celestial Serpent Adi Sesha. Lord Vittala's consort is Rakumayi.

title: Shirdi Sai we remember You
lyrics:
Our Loving thoughts are ever with You
 How we love You!
 Sathya Sai We adore You
 We speak our words before You
 How we love You!
 Prema Sai we expect You
 By our deeds we'll respect You
 How we'll love You!
 Trinity within us
 Creator, preserver, destroyer of us
 How we love all three!

title: Shirdi Vasi Sai Baba
title2: Shirdi Vasi Sai Baba Parthi Vasi Sai Baba
lyrics:
O Merey Sai Merey Prana Natha 
Terey Dar Pey Aayey Hai Hum 
Darshan Dey Darshan Dey
O Merey Sai Merey Baba 
Shirdi Vasi Sai Baba
Sab Ka Malik Ek Hai Sai 
Sai Hai Jeevan Jeevan Jyothi 
O Merey Sai Merey Baba
Shirdi Vasi Sai Baba
meaning: O Sai Baba, residing in Shirdi and Parthi, You are my Lord, the one who carries the vital force of life. We have come to Your doorstep, O Lord, please give us a glimpse of Your Divine Form. Sai, You are the Lord of all, and You are the light of life and life itself.

title: Shirdiyil Vazhnda Baba
title2: Shirdiyil Vazhnda Baba Puttaparthiyil Piranda Baba
lyrics:
Prashanthi Nilaya Baba Trayee Brindavana Baba
Shivashakti Vadivame Baba Brahma Sattiyame Ni Baba
Kaliyuga Deivame Va Va Ennai Kattarulvai Ni Baba (2)
meaning: Baba, who lived in Shirdi, born now in Parthi as incarnation of Shiva and Shakti, is the embodiment of Truth. Please grace us, O Lord of Kali age.

title: Shiva Baila Shiva Toca Tu Tambor,
title2: Shiva Baila Shiva Toca Tu Tambor,
lyrics:
La Danza Cósmica Baila Señor
Tandava Tu Danza Toca Tu Tambor
   Para Que El Universo Gire En Torno De Tu Son
Eres El Espacio, Tiempo Y Universo, 
   Vida Y Trascendencia Baila Mi Señor
meaning:
Lord Shiva, dance and play your drum, the cosmic dance, dance Oh Lord.
Tandava your dance, come and play your drum so the Universe can spin at
the rhythm of your beat. You are the space, time and Universe, Life and
transcendence Dance my Lord.

title: Shiva Charana Ati Taruna Nith
title2: Shiva Charana Ati Taruna Nith Nith Bhajey Hum
lyrics:
Nith Nith Bhajey Hum Guru Charanam Vande [ Shiva Charana ... ]
Shiva Charana Ati Taruna Guru Charana Sharanam
Sathya Charanam Sai Charanam Sathya Sai Charanam
Sathya Sai Charanam Nith Nith Bhajey Hum
meaning: We offer our Salutations at the divine feet of Lord Sai who is none other than Lord Shiva. We offer our obeisance at His feet by singing His glory incessantly.

title: Shiva great God almighty
title2: Shiva great God almighty, Shiva great God
lyrics:
almighty, Shiva great God almighty, our Sai
 Shiva we sing to praise You, Lord of the mountain,
 Shiva, now in the form of Sai
 Destroyer of evil, great God Shiva
 Lord of all living beings, great God Shiva
 Lord of man, Lord of souls, Lord of all beyond
 Shiva great God within, Shiva great God within,
 Shiva great God on high, our Sai
 Shiva we sing to praise You, Lord of the
 mountain, now in the form of Sai
 Destroyer of illusion, almighty Shiva
 Lord of man, Lord of worlds, Lord of all beyond

title: Shiva Hara Hey Hara Shiva
title2: Shiva Hara Hey Hara Shiva Hey
lyrics:
Samba Sadashiva Shiva Hara Hey
Hara Hara Hara Hara Mahadeva
Parvathi Ramana Sadashiva
Namami Shankara Tava Charanam
Bhajami Shankara Tava Charanam
meaning: We offer our obeisance at the feet of Lord Shiva who is worshipped as Sadashiva, Mahadeva and as the consort of Mother Parvathi.

title: Shiva Kumarane Shakthi Balane Va
title2: Shiva Kumarane Shakthi Balane Va Va Va
lyrics:
Sharavana Bhava Guha Shanmuga Vela Va Va Va
Omkara Tattuvame Ni Va Va Va
Parthipurisha Sai Natha Va Va Va
Kanda Va Va Va
Vela Va Va Va
Sai Va Va Va
meaning: Grace us with Your presence, O Lord Shanmukha, son of Shiva and Shakthi (Parvathi). You are the inner meaning of Omkara. Please come, O Lord Sai, residing in Parthi.

title: Shiva Linga Mangalaanga
lyrics:
Sri Ganga Gowri Linga [ Shiva Linga ... ]
Mandara Mala Linga
Nandeeshwara Rama Linga
Sri Ganga Dhari Linga
Shivarathri Atma Linga
meaning: Salutations to the most auspicious Form of Lord Shiva, the Shiva Linga. Glory to the Linga that embodies Mother Gowri (Parvathi) and Ganga. Glory to the Form adorned with a garland made of Mandara flowers and that bears the river Ganga, the Form that was worshipped by Lord Rama and Nandi, the Form that is enshrined in the hearts of devotees and is worshipped on the Holy occassion of Shivarathri.

title: Shiva Maheshwara Shiva Maheshwara Shiva
title2: Shiva Maheshwara Shiva Maheshwara Shiva Maheshwara Sai Ram
lyrics:
Shiva Maheshwara Shiva Shankara Shiva Mahadeva Sai Ram
Kailasa Vasa Mahadeva
Jagadeeshwara Hara Mahadeva
Tribhuvana Pala Baba Sai Deva
meaning: Salutations to Lord Shiva, also known as Maheshwara, who resides in the holy mountains of Kailasa. We sing Your glory, O Lord Sai, You are the Lord and protector of all creatures in the three worlds. (According to Hindu mythology there are three worlds, Sky, Earth and Sub-terrain.)

title: Shiva Nataraj donde estas?
lyrics:
En El Corazon De La Verdad [ Shiva Nataraj ... ]
Baila Al Ritmo Del Tambor,
Ven Conmigo, Oh Señor.
meaning: Dancing Shiva, where are you? You are in the truth of truth. Dance to the rhythm of the drum; come with me, O my Lord.

title: Shiva Nataraj Nataraj We Surrender
lyrics:
Jai We Surrender
Shiva Nataraj Nataraj We Surrender
Jai We Surrender
Come Lift The Veil Lift The Veil Of Illusion
Light Up Our Heart And Dispel Our Confusion
Jai We Surrender
Shiva We Surrender To You

title: Shiva no Ai ni
title2: Shiva no Ai ni Tsutsumarete Inochi Sakasou Sai Ram
lyrics:
Shiva wo Tatae Shiva ni Inori Shiva wo Utaou Sai Ram
Yuuki wo Ataetamae
Kami no Moto eto Michibikitamae
Sonshin Sathya Sai Shiva Sai Ram
meaning: Let us surround ourselves with Lord Shiva's love to allow our lives to bloom. Let us praise Lord Shiva, pray to Lord Shiva and sing the glory of Lord Shiva. Please gift us with courage, please lead us to God. We revere You, Lord Sathya Sai Shiva.

title: Shiva Om Shiva Om Shiva
title2: Shiva Om Shiva Om Shiva Om Shiva Om
lyrics:
Shiva Om Shiva Om Shiva Om Sai Om
Bhaktha Jana Priya Bhakthon Ke Pran Hai Sai Natha Shiva Om
Jai Jai Jai Shiva Om
Shanthi Pradayaka Prema Pradayaka Sai Natha Shiva Om [ Jai Jai ]
meaning: Salutations to Lord Shiva who is the embodiment of Primordial Sound, "Om" and who is the protector of His Devotees, who bestows peace and love among all beings.

title: Shiva Priya Nandana Bhava Bhaya
title2: Shiva Priya Nandana Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana
lyrics:
Gowri Priya Sutha Om Shadanana [ Shiva Priya ... ]
Hey Mayurasana Smitha Vadana
Sindhura Vadana Shubha Charana
Shanmukha Natha Subrahmanya (Sathya Sai) Deva
meaning: We pray to Lord Shanmukha who is the son of Lord Shiva and Mother Gowri and the one who removes all fears of the materialistic world, the one who sits on a peacock and whose face is charming, the one whose face is of reddish-brown color and whose Holy Feet is worshipped by all. He is none other than Lord Sathya Sai.

title: Shiva Sai Shankara Gangadhara (Hey)
lyrics:
Parthi Vihara Sayeeshwara [ Shiva Sai ... ]
Trishoola Dhari Hey Shiva Shankara
Deena Dayala Sayeeshwara
Lingodhbhavakara Lingeshwara [ Parthi Vihara ... ]
meaning: This song extols the glory of Lord Sai who is none other than Lord Shiva with attributes like, Gangadhara (the one who holds mighty Ganges in His matted locks), Trishoola Dhari (armed with Trident) Deena Dayala (compassionate to downtrodden), Lingodhbhavakara (the one who manifests the sacred Lingam).

title: Shiva Shambho Hara Hara Shambho
lyrics:
Bhava Nasha Kailasa Nivasa [ Shiva Shambho ... ]
Parvathi Pathey Harey Pashupathey
Gangadhara Hara Gowri Pathey
meaning: O Lord Shiva, You are the destroyer of all fear, the one who resides in the holy mountains of Kailasa, the consort of Mother Parvathi, the one who holds the mighty Ganges in Your matted locks, the consort of Mother Gowri. We pray and offer our humble salutations at Your Feet.

title: Shiva Shambho Narayana
lyrics:
Parthi Vasa Jagadeeshwara [ Shiva Shambho ... ]
Shirdi Vasa Jagadeeshwara
Sathya Sai Shiva Shankara
meaning: We pray to our Lord Sai who is the embodiment of Lord Shiva and Lord Narayana who has come down to earth as the Lord of Parthi and Shirdi and the Lord of all the worlds. We surrender to you Oh Lord Sathya Sai Shiva Shankara.

title: Shiva Shambho Shambho Shiva Shambho
title2: Shiva Shambho Shambho Shiva Shambho Mahadeva
lyrics:
Hara Hara Hara Hara Mahadeva Shiva Shambho Mahadeva
Haalaahala Dhara Shambho Anatha Natha Shambho
Hari Om (Om Om) Hari Om Hari Om Namah Shivaya
meaning: We sing the glory of Lord Shiva (Shambho Mahadeva), the one who has consumed the poison to save the world and the one who is compassionate and protects the needy and downtrodden. We pray to You, O Lord Shiva and offer our salutations.

title: Shiva Shankara Parvathi Ramana
lyrics:
Gangadhara Bhuvanaabharana
Sharanagatha Vanditha Charana
Karunakara Bhava Bhaya Harana
meaning: Glory to Lord Shiva Shankara who is the consort of Mother Parvathi, the one who holds the mighty Ganges in His Locks and whose radiance shines brilliantly over all worlds. We surrender and offer our prayers at Your Holy Feet Oh Lord who is most Compassionate and the one and who removes all fears.

title: Shiva Shiva Auspicious Shiva
title2: Shiva Shiva Auspicious Shiva Sai Shiva
lyrics:
Omnipotent Shiva Omnipresent Sai [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
You hold the world in the palm of Your hands
Past, present, future, at Your command
Shirdi Shiva Sathya Shiva Sai Shiva

title: Shiva Shiva Hara Hara
lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Shankara Samba Sadashiva [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shivaya Namah Om
Hara Hara Hara Hara Haraya Namah Om
Om Namah Shivaya Shivaya Namah Om
meaning: Chant the name of Lord Shiva who is also known as Lord Shankara and Samba Sadashiva.

title: Shiva Shiva Hara Hara Bhola
title2: Shiva Shiva Hara Hara Bhola Maheshwara Shambho Shankara
lyrics:
Ganga Jatadhara Gowri Manohara Shambho Shankara [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Vyagrambaradhara Chandrakaladhara Shambho Shankara
Haalaahala Dhara Shaila Girishwara Shambho Shankara [ Ganga Jatadhara ... ]
meaning: Salutations to Lord Shiva who is also known by other names such as Hara, Bhola Maheshwara and Shambho Shankara. He supports the sacred river Ganga on His matted hair. He is the Consort of Gowri (Parvathi) and wears tiger skin, adorns the crescent shaped moon on His head and lives in mount Kailasa. He is the one who swallowed the poison to save Gods (during the conflict between the Gods and Demons. That is why Lord Shiva is called haalaa-hala dhara or Neelakanta - blue throated).

title: Shiva Shiva Hara Hara Shankara
lyrics:
Trishoola Dhari Trinetra Dhari [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Chandrakaladhara Samba Shiva
Kailasa Vasa Gangadhari
Sayeeshwara Sarveshwara Hey Jagadeeshwara
meaning: Salutations to Lord Sai who is the embodiment of Lord Shiva, who is armed with Trident, has a third eye on His forehead, the Crescent moon on the head, who lives in Mount Kailasa, supports the sacred river Ganga on His head. He is the Lord of the Universe.

title: Shiva Shiva Sai Shankara Roopa
lyrics:
Shiva Parameshwara Samba Shiva
Hara Hara Hara Hara Bhola Shankara
Shirdi (Parthi) Pureeshwara Sai Shiva
Samba Shiva Sai Shiva (2)
meaning: Salutations to Lord Sai who is the embodiment of Lord Shankara (Shiva). He is worshipped by many as Lord Parameshwara, Samba Shiva and Bhola Shankara. The One who took the form of the Lord of Shirdi is now with us as the Lord of Parthi.

title: Shiva Shiva Shambho Hara Hara
title2: Shiva Shiva Shambho Hara Hara Shambho Sai Shambho Shankara
lyrics:
Vyagrambaradhara Vibhuti Sundara Sai Shambho Shankara
Chandrakala Dhara Shankara Ganga Jatadhara Shankara
Tandava Priyakara Natana Manohara Haalaahala Dhara Shankara [ Vyagrambaradhara ... ]
meaning: Sing the glory of Lord Shiva, the one who wears the tiger skin, who besmears ashes all over His body, the one with the crescent moon on His head and the Ganges flowing from His matted locks, the one who loves to do the Cosmic dance, the one who swallowed the deadly poison and held it inside His throat (during the conflict between the Gods and Demons. Hence, Lord Shiva is also called Neela Kanta, the blue-throated one).

title: Shiva Shiva Shambho Kailasa Pathey
lyrics:
Bhola Maheshwara Sai Shiva [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Alakh Niranjana Nataraja
Bhasma Vibhushitha Sambha Shiva
Om Hari Om Hari Om Hari Om
Tandava Priyakara Sai Shiva [ Bhola Maheshwara ... ]
meaning: Glory to Thee, O Lord Shiva, the auspicious one who resides on Mount Kailasa. You are the Greatest God, the protector of the innocent. You are beyond attributes, one who is free of all blemishes. You are adorned with sacred ash and the one who loves the Tandava dance. You are none other than Lord Sai.

title: Shiva Shiva Shambho Mahesha Girisha
lyrics:
Hara Hara Sai Mahadeva [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Nandi Vahana Naga Bhooshana
Phaala Lochana Tripura Samhari
Parama Purusha Shiva Ganga Dhari
Chandrakaladhara Parvathi Ramana
meaning: Salutations to Lord Sai who is none other than Lord Shiva, the consort of Parvathi. Salutations to the one who resides on Mount Kailasa, who moves around on Nandi, the celestial Bull, who wears the serpent as an ornament around His neck, has a third eye on the forehead, holds the sacred river Ganga and crescent moon on His head and who slayed the demon Tripura.

title: Shiva Shiva Shambho Tandava Priyakara
lyrics:
Bhava Bhava Bhairava Bhavani Shankara [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Hara Hara Bham Bham Bhola Maheshwara
Dama Dama Damaru Natana Manohara
Sathyam Shivam Sai Sundara
meaning: This song extols the attributes associated with Lord Sai who is none other than Lord Shiva. He is described as the one who loves Cosmic dance (Tandava Priyakara), simple in nature (Bhola) and personification of Truth (Sathyam), Goodness (Shivam) and Beauty (Sundaram).

title: Shiva Shiva Shankara Hara Parameshwara
lyrics:
Bala Gangadhara Sai
Shiva Shiva Shankara Parthi Pureeshwara
Nata Shiva Shankara Sai [ Bala Gangadhara ... ]
meaning: Worship Shiva who is also known as Hara, Shankara, Gangadhara, Parameshwara and Nata Shiva Shankara (the one who performs Cosmic dance). He is also Lord of Parthi.

title: Shiva Shiva Shankara Naama Bhajo
lyrics:
Hara Hara Shankara Naama Bhajo
Shankara Abhayankara Pralayankara Shankara Naama Bhajo [ Shiva Shiva ... , Hara Hara ... ]
Narthana Sundara Tripurari
Vibhuti Sundara Avatari
Jaya Jaya Shankara Hara Sai
meaning: Worship Lord Shiva and sing His name. Praise be unto the name of Lord Shiva. He grants fearlessness and destroys all evil. His dance enchants all. He is beyond the three worlds. The Lord of Vibhuti (sacred ash) has incarnated. Victory to Lord Shiva, who has come to this world as Lord Sathya Sai.

title: Shiva Shiva Shankara Om Shiva
title2: Shiva Shiva Shankara Om Shiva Om
lyrics:
Hara Hara Shankara Om Shiva Om [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Gowri Shankara Om Shiva Om
Uma Maheshwara Om Shiva Om
Shiva (Om) Shiva Shakthi Om Shiva Om
Neelakanta Sai Om Shiva Om
meaning: Chant the name of Lord Shiva who is accompanied by Divine Mother Gowri (Parvathi) also known as Uma and Shakthi. Chant the name of Neelakanta (another name for Shiva as His throat looks blue after swallowing poison for the sake of Gods during their fight for nectar with demons) who is verily Lord Sai.

title: Shiva Shiva Shankara Parthi Pureeshwara
lyrics:
Vyagrambaradhara Sai Maheshwara [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Haalaahala Dhara Hey Gangadhara
Natana Manohara Chandra Kaladhara
Samba Sadashiva Hara Parameshwara
meaning: Lord Sai, the resident of Parthi is none other than Lord Shankara, who wears the tiger skin, who swallowed the poison for saving the gods, who holds the sacred river Ganges in His matted hair, who is fond of dance and who wears the crescent moon on the head.

title: Shiva Shiva Shankara Sayeeshwara
lyrics:
Pranamami Pranamami Partheeshwara
Omkara Roopa Vishweshwara
Sayeeshwara Sarveshwara
Prema Swaroopa Partheeshwara [ Pranamami Pranamami ]
meaning: Reverential salutations to Lord Sai of Parthi who is the primordial sound "OM" in human form. HE is worshipped by all in the Universe and HE is Love personified.

title: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shambho
title2: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shambho Hara Hara Hara Shambho Shiva Shiva Hara Shambho
lyrics:
Jaya Kailasa Nivasa Mahesha Jaya Jaya Jaya Shambho [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Jaya Jaya Jaya Shambho Shiva Shiva Shiva Shambho Hara Hara Hara Shambho [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Parthi Vihara Rudrakaara Loka Anugraha Leela Damaruka Dhara Mandara Mala Shiva Shiva Shiva Shambho [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
meaning: Victory to Lord Shiva, the greatest Lord who resides in Mount Kailasa, who is the very embodiment of goodness and the one who took the form of Rudra. Glory to the one who manifested Himself for the sake of the whole universe and its people. Glory to the one who is adorned with the garland made of Mandara flowers and who plays the 'Damaru' drum. Glory to Lord Sai, Lord who resides at Parthi who is verily Lord Shiva.

title: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva
title2: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Hara Hey
lyrics:
Hara Hara Hara Hara Hara Shiva Hey
Shiva Hara Hey Hara Shiva Hey
Dhim Dhim Baajey Vadya Mrudanga
Nachey Shankara Shiva Hara Hey
Ghana Ghana Ghana Ghana Ghanta Baajey
Nachey Shankara Shiva Hara Hey [ Shiva Hara Hey ... ]
meaning: Glory to Thee O Lord Shiva, dance to the rhythm of the Mrudanga and the "Ghan Ghan" sound of the bell.

title: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Om
title2: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Om Hara Hara Hara Hara Om
lyrics:
Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Hara Hara Hara Hara Sai Shankara Om
Sai Shankara Om (Sathya) (2)
Om Namah Shivaya Om Om Namah Shivaya Om
Dama Dama Dama Dama Damaru Bholey Bholey Shankara Om
Bholey Shankara Om (2) [ Om Namah ... ]
meaning: Worship Lord Shiva who is a remover of all sins and cycle of birth and death, whose Damaru (the miniature drum) chants "Om Shankara". He has incarnated as Lord Sai residing in Parthi.

title: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Om
title2: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Om Hara Hara Hara Hara Om
lyrics:
Hara Hara Hara Hara Om Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Om
Hey Rudra Bhairava
Bhavani Shankara
Shambho Shankara
Shiva Shambho Shankara
meaning: Glory to Lord Shiva, also hailed as Rudra Bhairava, who destroys one's evil tendencies and ignorance. Glory to Lord Shankara, the Consort of Mother Bhavani (Parvathi) who wards off the dangers of His devotees. Salutations to the Lord who is the very source and bestower of auspiciousness.

title: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shambho
title2: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shambho Shiva
lyrics:
Hara Hara Hara Hara Sadashiva [ Shiva Shiva ]
Tandava Priyakara Shambho Sabesha
Parthi Mahesha Sai Shiva
meaning: Chant the holy name of Shiva, Shambho and Sadashiva, Hara who is fond of celestial dance Tandava. He is also the Lord of Parthi, Sai Shiva.

title: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shirdi
title2: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shirdi Pureeshwara Shambho Shankara Samba Shivom
lyrics:
Bhava Hara Purahara Puttapartheeshwara Shambho Shankara Sada Shivom
Kailasachala Bala Shiva Kalakoota Dhara Bala Shiva
Keli Lalasa Bala Shiva Leela Tandava Bala Shiva
meaning: O Lord Sai, Lord of Shirdi and Parthi, we worship You as Shiva, Parameshwara, Shambho and Shankara. You are the remover of fear and worldly misery, Your abode is Kailasa and You are a great dancer of the Tandava (Celestial Dance).

title: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva
title2: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shankara
lyrics:
Gangadhara Hara Gowreeshwara [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Chandrakaladhara Parameshwara
Haalaahala Dhara Hara Shankara
Yugadhara Phanidhara Shashi Shekara
Jatadhara Sai Bhaktha Shankara
meaning: Worship Lord Shiva who is called by many names such as, Shankara, Gangadhara (the one who supports the sacred river Ganga on His head), Hara, Gowreeshwara (Consort of Mother Gowri), Chandrakaladhara (having crescent moon on the head), Haalaa-hala dhara (the one who swallowed the poison to save Gods), Yugadhara (the one who upholds all eons), Jatadhara (the one with matted hair). Glory to Lord Sai, Lord of Parthi who is none other than the Lord Shiva who adorns the serpent around His neck.

title: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shivaya
title2: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shivaya Namah Om
lyrics:
Hara Hara Hara Hara Haraya Namah Om [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Alakh Niranjana Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana
Sayeeshwaraya Namah Om
Pranava Swaroopa Parameshwara
Partheeshwaraya (Sathya Sayeeshwaraya) Namah Om
meaning: Worship Lord Shiva with the mantra "Shivaya Namah Om Haraya Namah Om". Pray to Lord Shiva who is ever pure, who dispels the fear of this materialistic world, who is the personification of the Primordial "Om". He is none other than Lord Sai, Lord of Parthi.

title: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shivaya
title2: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shivaya Namah Om
lyrics:
Om Namah Shivaya Shivaya Namah Om [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Hara Hara Hara Hara Haraya Namah Om
Om Namah Shivaya Shivaya Namah Om
meaning: Prostrations to You, O Lord Shiva, the destroyer of sins and evils. Let us chant "Om Namah Shivaya"

title: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shivaya
title2: Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Shivaya Namah Om
lyrics:
Hara Hara Hara Hara Haraya Namah Om [ Shiva Shiva ... ]
Shivaya Namah Om Haraya Namah Om
Hara Hara Hara Hara Haraya Namah Om
Shivaya Namah Om Haraya Namah Om [ Hara Hara ... ]
meaning: Chant the name of Lord Shiva, the destroyer of sins and the cycle of birth and death.

title: Shiva Shiva Shivaya Bhava
title2: Shiva Shiva Shivaya Bhava Bhava Bhavaya Hara Hara Hara Hara Shambho
lyrics:
Tribhuvana Palaka Haalaahala Dhara Shambho
Om Hara Hara Hara Hara Shambho
Hey Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana Alakh Niranjana
Pranavakaara Shambho
Gangadhara Hara Gowri Shankara
(Hara) Samba Sadashiva Shambho (2)
meaning: Glory to Lord Shiva, the one who is auspiciousness personified and the one who destroys the fear of this materialistic world. He is the sustainer of the three worlds, the one who swallowed the 'haalaahala' poison for the sake of His devotees. He is supremely pure and is the very embodiment of Om (Pranava). Glory to the consort of Gowri and the one who holds the Holy river Ganga in His matted locks. Glory to the eternally blissful Lord.

title: Shiva Shiva Shivaya Namah Om
lyrics:
Bhava Bhava Bhavaya Namah Om
Shirdi (Parthi) Pureeshwara Shambho Shankara
Hara Hara Haraya Namah Om
Parthi Shivaya Namah Om
Samba Shivaya Namah Om
Parthi Pureeshwara Shambho Shankara [ Hara Hara ... ]
meaning: Chant the name of Lord Shiva who dispels the fear of the materialistic world, He is none other than Shirdi Sai and Parthi Sai.

title: Shiva, Lord Of My Heart
lyrics:
Destroying all the evil in the world,
Shiva, Lord of my heart,
Purify me, let me hold the light.
Now I love You, how I love You, Shiva; Shiva, You are always in my heart.

title: Shiva, Shiva, hear us call
lyrics:
We chant Your Name Lord Shiva
 We worship You Lord Shiva
 We bow to You Lord Shiva (Shiva)
 Who holds the Ganga in His hair (1X)
 Who holds the trident, twirling in the air (1X)
 Who plays the hand drum resounding everywhere
 Pounding, pounding, pounding sound
 Resounding everywhere
 Hear the whirling dance of Lord Shiva
 We bow to you Lord Shiva
 We sing to You Lord Shiva
 We worship You Lord Shiva
 We chant Your Name Lord Shiva

title: Shivaya Namah Om Namah Shivaya
meaning: Worship Shiva and chant His name.

title: Shivaya Namah Shiva Lingaya Namah
title2: Shivaya Namah Shiva Lingaya Namah Om
lyrics:
Bhavaya Namah Bhava Lingaya Namah Om
Sarvaya Namah Sarva Lingaya Namah Om
Rudraya Namah Rudra Lingaya Namah Om
Bhasmaya Namah Bhasma Lingaya Namah Om
Atmaya Namah Atma Lingaya Namah Om
Namah Om Namah Om Namah Om
meaning: Worship Lord Shiva who is present in the form of sacred Lingam. He manifests Himself in different forms such as, the one who dispels the fear of the materialistic world, the one who is Omnipresent, the one who is our in-dweller (higher self or Conscience).

title: Shivaya Namah Shiva Shivaya Namah
title2: Shivaya Namah Shiva Shivaya Namah Shiva Shivaya Namah Om Namah Shivaya
lyrics:
Shivaya Namah Shiva Shivaya Namah Shiva
Shivaya Namah Om Namah Shivaya
meaning: Chant "Shivaya Namah Shiva" every moment of your life. Salutations to Lord Shiva.

title: Shivaya Parameshwaraya Chandrashekaraya Namah
lyrics:
Haraya Haraya Haraya Namah Om
Shankaraya Namah Om
Bhavaya Guna Sambhavaya Shiva Tandavaya Namah Om
Bhavaya Bhavaya Bhavaya Namah Om
Guna Sambhavaya Namah Om
meaning: Bow to Lord Shiva, who is the Lord of the Universe with a crescent moon on His hair, who loves the Tandava (cosmic) dance, who gives us virtues to go through our cycle of birth and death.

title: Shivaya Parameshwaraya Chandrashekaraya Namah Om
lyrics:
Bhavaya Guna Sambhavaya Shiva Tandavaya Namah Om
Shivaya Parameshwaraya Chandrashekaraya Namah Om [ Bhavaya Guna ... ]
alt_lyrics:
Shivaya Parameshwaraya Sashi Shekaraya Namah Om
Bhavaya Guna Sambhavaya Shiva Tandavaya Namah Om
Shivaya Parameshwaraya Chandrashekaraya Namah Om [ Bhavaya Guna ... ]
meaning: Chant the name of Lord Shiva, the supreme one, who dispels the fear of the materialistic world, the one who adorns the crescent shaped moon on His head and performs the cosmic dance.

title: Shivaya Shiva Sai Deva Chandrashekaraya
title2: Shivaya Shiva Sai Deva Chandrashekaraya Namah Om
lyrics:
Bhavaya Partheeshwaraya Devadi Devaya Namah Om
Namah Om Namah Om Namah Om
Namah Om Namah Om Namah Om Namah Om
meaning: Chant name of Lord Sai, who is none other than Lord Shiva who dispels the fear of the materialistic world.

title: Shivaya Shiva Shiva Bhavaya Bhava
title2: Shivaya Shiva Shiva Bhavaya Bhava Bhava
lyrics:
Om Namah Shivaya Namah Shivaya
Shivaya Shiva Shiva Bhavaya Bhava Bhava
Om Namah Shivaya Namah Shivaya
Bhavaya Bhava Bhava Haraya Hara Hara [ Om Namah ]
meaning: Chant the name of Shiva with the mantra "Om Namah Shivaya" which dispels one's worldly miseries.

title: Shivoham Shivoham Shivoham Shiva
lyrics:
Satchidananda Roopam Shivoham Shiva
Shivoham Shivoham Shivoham Shiva [ Satchidananda ... ]
meaning: I am Shiva (Shivoham, which is a primary chant of Shaivism, which means Shiva I am {Shiva-Aham }) the embodiment of Being (Sath), Awareness (Chith) and Bliss (Ananda).

title: Shravan Karo Manan Karo
lyrics:
Sai Mahima Sai Mahima
Trikhand Nachey Sai Mahima Se (2) [ Shravan Karo ... ]
Yuga Avatari Leeladhari (2)
Parthi Pureeshwara Prabhu Giridhari
Narahari Roopa Sai Giridhari
meaning: Listen and meditate on the glory of the Avatar of this Age, Lord Sai, residing in Parthi, who is none other than Lord Krishna in human form. The three worlds dance to His melody. (As per Indian Mythology the three worlds are Sky, Earth and the sub-terrain below the ocean).

title: Shri Rama Rama Rama Ram
lyrics:
Japte Manabhi Ram
Sitapati Ramachandra
Dasharatha Priya Nandana
Hanumath Sri Charana Vandana
Pooran Hota Man Ki Kamna [ Japte Manabhi ... ]
meaning: Chanting in our minds the name of Lord Rama, the consort of Sita and Dasaratha's favorite son, and at whose Feet Hanuman served, will fulfill our desires and wishes.

title: Shringara Vela Shiva Shakthi Bala
lyrics:
Devadi Deva Deena Dayala [ Shringara Vela ... ]
Kanda Kumara Kadirkama Vela
Karunya Sheela Shritha Paripala
meaning: Chant name of Lord Subrahmanya, beautiful and compassionate son of Shiva and Shakthi, who is also called by the name Kanda and Kumara. He is none other than Lord Sathya Sayeesha who protects those who surrender to Him.

title: Shrivatsankitha Sri Kaustubha Dhara
lyrics:
Madhava Mohana Krishna (2)
Sri Tulasi Dala Vanamala Dhara [ Madhava Mohana ... (2) ]
Kali Yuga Varada Kali Avatara
Karuna Sagara Sai (2)
meaning: Glory to Lord Sai, the compassionate one who is the incarnation of Lord Vishnu in Kali age, who is depicted to be bearing the sign of "Srivatsa" (it symbolizes Vishnu's yogic powers) and the splendorous jewel "Kaustubha" (it represents the consciousness of all living things). He is none other than Lord Krishna wearing the garland of Sacred Tulasi leaves (Basil Leaves).

title: Shubha Janama Din
title2: Shubha Janama Din Shubha Janama Din
lyrics:
Sri Sathya Sai Bhagawan
Tava Madhura Naama Ananda Gaana
Sri Sathya Sai Bhagawan (2)
Happy Birthday To You (2)
Happy Birthday Dear Swami
Happy Birthday To You
meaning: This is an auspicious day as it is the Birthday of Lord Sri Sathya Sai Baba. O Lord Sai, Thy name is supremely sweet and immerses us in bliss. Happy Birthday to You, dear Sai.

title: Shubha Mangala Dayaka Vinayaka
lyrics:
Gajavadana Gananatha Gajanana [ Shubha Mangala ... ] 
Mooshika Vahana Modaka Hasta 
Jaya Lambodara Vighna Vinasha 
Pashankusha Dhara Paapa Vinasha 
Parthi Pureeshwara Sai Gajanana
meaning: Praise be to Lord Ganesha, the bestower of auspiciousness. His vehicle is the mouse and He enjoys the sweet Modaks. He is the remover of all obstacles and the destroyer of sin. Residing in Puttaparthi, He is none other than our Lord Sai.

title: Shuklambara Dharam Ganapathi Mantram
lyrics:
Nithyam Nithyam Bhajo Bhajo
Vighna Vinashaka Vishwam Vyapaka
Veera Ganapathi Bhajo Bhajo
alt_lyrics:
Shuklambara Dhara Ganapathi Mantram
Nithyam Nithyam Japo Japo
Vighna Vinashaka Vidya Dayaka
Veera Ganapathi Bhajo Bhajo
meaning: Chant daily the Mantra of Lord Ganapathi (Ganesha), the one who wears a white cloth, the remover of all obstacles, the bestower of knowledge and the one who is very courageous.

title: Shyam Ghana Shyam Megha Shyam
title2: Shyam Ghana Shyam Megha Shyam Radhey Shyam
lyrics:
Ghana Shyama Sundara Shyama Manohara [ Shyam Ghana Shyam ... ]
Shyama Kanhaiya Hey Giridhari
Vanamali Bansidhari Krishna Murari Ghana Shyam
Meera Ke Prabhu Giridhara Shyam
meaning: Sing the praises of Lord Krishna, who is of a beautiful dark complexion and is the beloved of Radha. He lifted the Govardhana mountain, is adorned with a garland of flowers, plays the melodious flute, and is the Lord of Meera.

title: Shyam Govinda Jaya Radhey Govinda
title2: Shyam Govinda Jaya Radhey Govinda Jaya
lyrics:
Sai Govinda Jaya Madhava
Gopala Krishna Jaya Gopi Manohara Jaya 
Madana Mohana Keshava
Bhajo Sadguru Naam
Harey Krishna Harey Ram
Paahi (Sai) Paada Pallava
meaning: Victory to the enchantingly beautiful Lord Govinda (Krishna) who is also glorified as Shyama, Madhava, Gopala and Keshava. He is Lord of Radha and the Gopikas. Sing the names of the Divine Preceptor Sai, Lord Krishna and Lord Rama. Surrender to the Lotus Feet of Lord Sai who is verily Lord Krishna.

title: Shyama Bhajo Bhajo Radhey Gopala
lyrics:
Shyama Manohara He Nandalala [ Shyama Bhajo ... ]
Murali Manohara Gopi Lola
Meera Ke Prabhu Giridhara Bala
meaning: Worship Gopala, the Lord of Radha. Lord Krishna, the dark-complexioned son of Nanda plays the enchanting flute. He is the beloved of the Gopis, and the Lord of Meera. He held the mountain up to protect His devotees.

title: Shyama Manohara He Giridhari
lyrics:
Radha Madhava Krishna Murari [ Shyama Manohara ... ]
Meera Ke Prabhu Natavara Lala
Narada Sangeeta Lola Gopala
meaning: The dark-hued and beautiful Lord Krishna, who held the mountain up, is Lord of Radha. He is the Lord of Meera and destroyer of Mura. Sage Narada sang His glory.
