title: Shyama Murari Ayo Rey
lyrics:
Sai Murari Ayo Rey [ Shyama Murari ... ]
Gaayo Rey Gun Gaayo Rey
Payo Rey Peetambara Dhari
meaning: Sing in ecstasy of the arrival of Lord Krishna who is none other than Lord Sai. Lord Krishna is also called Shyama (dark-hued) and Murari (slayer of the demon Mura). Wearing the yellow cloth is a characteristic of Lord Krishna's attire.

title: Shyama Murari Bansidhari
lyrics:
Jagadoddharana Leela Dhari [ Shyama Murari ... ]
Radha Meera Raasa Vihari
Krishna Ranga Ananda Dayi
Yaduvara Shyama Shyama Ghana Shyama
meaning: Glory to Lord Krishna of Yadu dynasty, who has a darkened complexion and who enchants all with the music of His flute. He is the redeemer of the world who enjoys playing divine sports. Radha and Meera join Him in Raasa Leela. Glory to the bestower of bliss.

title: Shyama Shyama Radhey Radhey Radhey
title2: Shyama Shyama Radhey Radhey Radhey Radhey Shyama Shyam (2)
meaning: Chant Lord Shyam, Radhey Shyam.

title: Shyama Sundara Hari Govinda Bolo
lyrics:
Govinda Bolo Hari Gopala Bolo [ Shyama Sundara ... ]
Madana Mohana Hari Govinda Bolo
Kamala Nayana Prabhu Gopala Bolo
Radha Ramana Hari Govinda Bolo
Govinda Bolo Gopala Bolo (3)
meaning: Chant the various names of Lord Krishna - Hari and Govinda. Glory to the beautiful, dark-hued, enchanting Lord with lotus petal eyes and who is dear to Radha.

title: Shyama Sundara Madana Mohana
lyrics:
Mora Makuta Dhari
Madhava Hari Madhava Hari Madhava Giridhari
meaning: Chant the various names of Lord Krishna, the dark-hued one who is beautiful and enchanting with a peacock feather in His crown. He is the one who lifted the Govardhana mountain to protect His devotees.

title: Shyama Sundara Madana Mohana Radhey
title2: Shyama Sundara Madana Mohana Radhey Gopal
lyrics:
Jai Radhey Gopal
Radhey Gopal Bhajo Radhey Gopal
Shankha Chakra Gadadhara Radhey Gopal
Jai Radhey Gopal [ Radhey Gopal ... ]
alt_lyrics:
Shyama Sundara Madana Mohana Radhey Gopal
Jai Radhey Gopal
Radhey Gopal Bhajo Radhey Gopal
Shankha Chakra Gadadhara Radhey Gopal
Jai Radhey Gopal [ Radhey Gopal ... ]
Murali Manohara Radhey Gopal
Jai Radhey Gopal [ Radhey Gopal ... ]
meaning: Chant the various names of Lord Krishna such as, Shyama Sundara, Madana Mohana, Shankha Chakra Gadadhara, Radhey Gopala, Murali Manohara etc.

title: Shyama Sundara Madana Mohana Radhey
title2: Shyama Sundara Madana Mohana Radhey Govinda Bolo Radhey Govinda
lyrics:
Yadu Nandana Madhusudhana Radhey Govinda Bolo Radhey Govinda
Nalina Nayana Narayana Radhey Govinda Bolo Radhey Govinda
Deena Charana Dukha Harana Radhey Govinda Bolo Radhey Govinda
meaning: Chant the name of the most beautiful and charming Lord Govinda (Krishna), the beloved of Radha. Chant the name of the child from Yadu dynasty and the annihilator of demon Madhu. Chant the name of the Lord with lotus eyes, the one who gives succor to the downtrodden and the one who removes our afflictions.

title: Shyamala Komala Krishna Murari
lyrics:
Shyamala Ghana Shyamala Megha Shyamala Komala Krishna Murari
Shyamala Komala Krishna Murari
Sridhara Yaduvara Krishna Murari (2)
Sridhara Nanda Yaduvara Bhava Bhaya Hara Giridhara Krishna Murari
Sridhara Yaduvara Krishna Murari
meaning: Chant the name of the dark complexioned and soft natured Krishna, who is also known as, Murari, Ghana Shyama, Megha Shyama, Sridhara, Yaduvara, Giridhara etc.

title: Si Me Caigo, Me Levantas
lyrics:
Me Proteges Con Tu Amor
Tu Sonrisa Es Todo El Cielo
Yo Te Quiero, Mi Señor.

Ay! Mi Señor, Sin Ti Yo No Podría
Ni Un Solo Paso Dar En Esta Vida.
meaning: O Lord Sai, if I fall You lift me up. You protect me with Your love. Your smile is all heaven. I love You my Lord. O Lord, without You I could not take even one step in life.

title: Siddhi Ranjana Duritha Bhanjana
lyrics:
Sri Sathya Sai Gajanana (Bolo)
Vighna Vinashaka Ashta Vinayaka
Sri Sathya Sai Shubhanana
Vakratunda Dhara Pranava Swaroopa
Sri Sathya Sai Shubhanana (Bolo)
meaning: Oh Lord Sai, You are none other than the Lord Gajanana (Ganesha), who bestows auspiciousness, removes the obstacles in life and fulfills every wish. You are the personification of the Primordial sound "Om".

title: Siddhi Vinayaka Mangala Daata
lyrics:
Buddhi Pradayaka Gananatha [ Siddhi Vinayaka ... ]
Vighna Harana Prabhu Vighneshwara Tum
Gowri Nandana Hey Jaga Vandana
Namostuthey Namostuthey
meaning: Oh Lord Vinayaka (Lord Ganesha), You fulfill our wishes and bestow auspiciousness. You bestow knowledge to all, Oh Lord of Ganaas, You destroy the obstacles in our lives. Oh son of Goddess Gowri (Parvathi), You are worshipped by the entire Universe. Salutations to You, Oh Lord Vighneshwara.

title: Siddhi Vinayaka Paahi Gajanana
lyrics:
Gowri Nandana Hey Jagavandana [ Siddhi Vinayaka ... ]
Pashankusha Dhara Vighna Vinasha
Buddhi Pradayaka Paapa Vinasha
meaning: Salutations to the elephant-faced son of Gowri, Lord Ganesha, bestower of auspiciousness and knowledge. He is the master of the universe who removes obstacles and destroys sins and who carries the noose and the hook.

title: Siddhi Vinayaka Vidya Dayaka
lyrics:
Sri Gowri Sutha Vighna Nashaka
Shoka Vinashaka Duritha Nivaraka
Lambodhara Gajavadana Vinayaka
Sura Nara Sevitha Buddhi Pradayaka [ Sri Gowri ... ]
meaning: O Lord Vinayaka (Ganesha), You fulfill our wishes and bestow knowledge. O, son of Gowri (Parvathi) and remover of obstacles, You have a mighty body worshipped by Gods and humans alike, You provide intellect to the seekers.

title: Silent Night, Holy Night
lyrics:
All Is Calm, All Is Bright
Round Yon Virgin, Mother And Child
Holy Infant, Tender And Mild
Sleep In Heavenly Peace,
Sleep In Heavenly Peace.

Silent Night, Holy Night
Son Of God, Love's Pure Light
Radiant Beams From Thy Holy Face
With The Dawn Of Redeeming Grace,
Jesus, Lord At Thy Birth
Jesus, Lord At Thy Birth.

Silent Night, Holy Night
Shepherds Quake, At The Sight
Glories Stream From Heaven Above
Heavenly, Hosts Sing Hallelujah.
Christ The Savior Is Born,
Christ The Savior Is Born.

title: Simha Vahini Sai Narayani
lyrics:
Mata Maheshwari Durga Bhavani [ Simha Vahini ... ]
Akhilandeshwari Jaya Jagat Janani
Abhaya Pradayini Ananda Roopini
Mangala Karini Moksha Pradayini
meaning: Chant the name of Sai Narayani who rides on the Lion and who is known by many names as Maheshwari, Durga Bhavani, Akhilandeshwari, Jagat Janani, Abhaya Pradayini, Ananda Roopini, Mangala Karini and Moksha Pradayini.

title: Simha Vahini Trishoolini
lyrics:
Shritha Jana Palini Shiva Shankari [ Simha Vahini ... ]
Chidanandamayi Niramayi
Sadashivamayi Sayeeshwari
meaning: Worship the Goddess Shiva Shankari, the one who protects all who surrender to her, the one rides on the lion, carries the trident, one who is always full of bliss and happiness, one who is free from sorrow and fear, the consort of Sadashiva, the Goddess Sayeeshwari.

title: Simhasaneshwari Sayeeshwari
lyrics:
Shiva Vama Bhage Sarveshwari [ Simhasaneshwari ... ]
Vande Vande Jagadeeshwari
Vande Vande Parameshwari
meaning: Glory to Mother Parvathi who sits on the throne on the left side of Lord Shiva. Pay obeisance to the Mother of the Universe, Mother Sai, who is none other than Mother Parvathi.

title: Sindhura Vadana Gajanana
lyrics:
Siddhi Vinayaka Sai Gajanana [ Sindhura Vadana ... ]
Parvathi Nandana Bala Gajanana
Mruthyunjaya Sutha Veera Gajanana
Jaya Jaya Jaya Hey Gowri Nandana (2)
Jaya Partheeshwara Sai Gajanana
meaning: Worship the elephant-faced Lord Gajanana, the destroyer of obstacles and bestower of spiritual wisdom. Glory to the valorous son of Mother Parvathi (Gowri) and Lord Shiva. Glory to Lord Sai of Parthi who is verily Lord Ganesha.

title: Sing His Name With Pure Love
title2: Sing His Name With Pure Love Sathya Sai
lyrics:
Feel Him In My Heart Oh Sathya Sai [ Sing His Name ... ]
Fill My Heart With His Love
See Through His Sight Of Love
Hear His Voice Of Love
(For) Love, Love, Love Is Sathya Sai

title: Sing out His praise
title2: Sing out His praise, sing out His praise,
lyrics:
Praises to our Lord Sai,
 Sing out praises to our Lord Sai
 Lord of Puttaparthi, perfection and purity,
 Praise to God in human form
 Sing out His praise, sing out His praise,
 Praises to our Lord Sai,
 Sing out praises to our Lord Sai
 Light of all religions, You are everlasting,
 Here in answer to a human prayer,
 Heart's Delight of Your Mother Eshwaramba,
 Praises to our Lord Sai,
 Sing out praises to our Lord Sai

title: Sing the name of the Lord Sai Rama
title2: Sing the name of the Lord Sai Rama, Sai Rama, Sai Rama
lyrics:
Sai Rama, Sai Rama, let me hear you sing Sai Rama
Sing it loud and clear, sing it far and near, everyone must hear Sai's name
Sing Jehovah or Buddha, Nanak or Ram, every Form is one and the same [ Sai Rama, Sai Rama ... ]

title: Sing We
title2: Sing we, sing we together, now and forever, sing we of Swami,
lyrics: Swami, we are Your children, open our hearts, Lord, open our hearts.

title: Sing with love in your heart
title2: Sing with love in your heart, sing to the Lord
lyrics:
Feel His love from the start, sing to the Lord
 Sing to the Lord (3X), He's always with You
 Sing His Name, see His form, sing to the Lord
 Let Your Self be reborn, sing the Lord
 Sing to the Lord (3X), He's always with You
 If you like peace of mind, sing to the Lord
 Inner peace you will find, sing to the Lord
 Sing to the Lord (3X), He's always with You

title: Sing, in this bright new day
title2: Sing, sing, sing, sing, in this bright new day
lyrics:
Put on a smile, think constantly of Sai
 Love, love, love, love Him in all you see
 Yesterday's clouds make today's sun much stronger
 We've got the courage to serve all who need us
 We are the builders of Sai's new world together
 Respecting one another
 Loving one another

title: Sita Mohana Sundara Rama
lyrics:
Sri Rama Jaya Rama
Raghukula Bhooshana Sri Raghu Rama
Ratnakara Kula Sri Sai Rama
Raghava Sundara Sri Raghu Rama
Ramya Manohara Sri Sai Rama
meaning: Oh Sai Rama form the lineage of Ratnakara, you are Sri Rama from Raghu dynasty, consort of Mother Sita, you are the most beautiful and elegant Sai Rama.

title: Sita Pathey Rama Jaya Shyamala
title2: Sita Pathey Rama Jaya Shyamala Komala Rama
lyrics:
Veda Gamanutha Vimala Charitha
Vathathmaja Priya Rama
Varija Netra Rama
meaning: Salutations to You, O Lord Rama, the consort of Mother Sita. With Your dark complexion and soft nature, You are the personification of the essence of Vedas. You are the one with blemishless character and adored by Hanuman (Vathathmaja). You are most beautiful with lotus-shaped eyes.

title: Sita Pathey Sri Rama
lyrics:
Dasharatha Rama Dayabhi Rama [ Sita Pathey ... ]
Rama Rama Jaya Rama Rama Jaya Rama ( Sai ) Rama Jaya Ram
Jai Jai Ram Sai Ram Sathya Sai Ram Ram
Raghava Sundara Rajeeva Lochana Paramananda Ram
meaning: Victory to You O Lord Rama, the consort of Mother Sita. Victory to the one who is the son of King Dasharatha and the most merciful one, the one with Lotus shaped eyes, the most beautiful one from Raghu Dynasty and who bestows eternal bliss.

title: Sita Rakshaka Rama Dootha
lyrics:
Lanka Dahana Ravana Mardhana
Sri Rama Daasa Daya Nidhey
Sarva Mangala Anjaneya
meaning: Glory to You, O Lord Hanuman, You protected Mother Sita and is the messenger of Lord Rama. You are the one who put Lanka in flames and showed the path for Lord Rama who killed Ravana. You are the one who confers auspiciousness on everyone, the son of Anjana. We offer our salutations to You, O Lord Hanuman.

title: Sita Ram Bolo Bolo Sita
title2: Sita Ram Bolo Bolo Sita Ram Radhey Shyam Bolo Bolo Radhey Shyam
lyrics: Sai Ram Bolo Bolo Sai Ram (4)
alt_lyrics:
Sita Ram Bolo Bolo Sita Ram Radhey Shyam Bolo Bolo Radhey Shyam
Hari Naam Bolo Bolo Hari Naam
Sai Ram Bolo Bolo Sai Ram [ Sita Ram Bolo ... ]
Hari Naam Bolo Bolo Hari Naam
Sai Ram Bolo Bolo Sai Ram
Hari Naam Bolo Bolo Hari Naam
Sai Ram Bolo Bolo Sai Ram
meaning: Sing the names of Lord Rama, the consort of Mother Sita. Chant the names of Lord Krishna and Lord Sai.

title: Sita Ram Naam Bhajo
lyrics:
Madhura Madhura Sai Naam Bhajo
Radhey Shyam Naam Bhajo [ Madhura Madhura ... ]
meaning: Sing the Name and Glory of Lord Rama (Sita Ram), Lord Krishna (Radhey Shyam) and Lord Sai whose names are the sweetest of all.

title: Sita Ram Sita Ram Sita
title2: Sita Ram Sita Ram Sita Ram Radhey Shyam Radhey Shyam Radhey Shyam
lyrics:
Dasharatha Nandana Janaki Jeevana
Raghukula Bhooshana Jaya Jaya Ram
Jaya Jaya Ram (Ram) Jaya Sai Ram
meaning: Victory to Lord Rama, who is the crown jewel of Raghu Dynasty, who is the consort of Sita and the son of Dasharatha.

title: Sita Rama Jaya Radhey Shyama
title2: Sita Rama Jaya Radhey Shyama Jaya
lyrics:
Mangala Charana Jaga Vandana (Shubha)
Sita Pathey Ramachandra
Raghava Raghu Nandana
meaning: Salutations to You, Lord Rama from Raghu dynasty and the consort of Mother Sita. You are the same as the dark-complexioned Krishna. You bestow auspiciousness and the whole world prostrates at Your feet.

title: Sita Rama Sri Raghu Rama
lyrics:
Daasharathey Hey Jaya Rama
Atma Rama Aganita Guna Dhama
Pavana Naama Parandhama
meaning: Salutations to Lord Rama from Raghu dynasty, who is the consort of Mother Sita and the son of King Dasharatha. Lord Rama is the one with blemishless character, whose name is sacred and the one who is the supreme Lord.

title: Sita Rama Sri Raghu Rama
lyrics:
Ananda Roopa Hey Guna Dhama
Dasharatha Nandana Janaki Rama
Parthi Vihara Sri Sai Rama
Madhuvana Ramana Hey Ghana Shyama
Raasa Vilola Radhey Shyama
meaning: Glory to the consort of Sita, Lord Rama, of Raghu dynasty, the embodiment of bliss, the abode of good qualities. the son of Dasharatha and the consort of Mother Janaki (Sita). Glory to the dark-hued Lord Krishna of Madhuvana, who danced with the Gopis and who is the Lord of Radha. Lord Sai of Parthi is verily Rama and Krishna.

title: Sita Ramachandra ki
title2: Sita Ramachandra Ki Jai Jai Bolo
lyrics:
Veera Hanuman Ki Jai Jai Bolo [ Sita Ramachandra … ]
Gnana Guna Sagar Ki Jai Jai Bolo
Maruthi Bhagawan Ki Jai Jai Bolo
meaning: Chant victory to Lord Rama, the consort of Mother Sita. Victory to the valorous Lord Hanuman, the ocean of wisdom and supremely good qualities. Victory to the son of wind-god.

title: Siyabonga siyabonga wo Yesu
lyrics:
We say Thank you, thank you dear Jesus (. dear Swami) (4x)
 Onse danke danke vir Swami (4x)

title: Smarana Karo Bhagawan Sai Ram
lyrics:
Sai Ram Shubha Dayi Ram (2) [ Smarana Karo ... ]
Keertan Karo Tum Sai Ram
Sai Ram Shubha Dayi Ram
meaning: Chant and sing the name of Lord Sai Ram. He is the bestower of auspiciousness.

title: Smile, Smile, Smile
So Divine
title2: So divine is how we feel when we are with You
lyrics:
You fill our lives with the endless joy of love
And when You speak the whole world is in tune
 
Sathya Sai, how we feel when we’re with You
Sacrifice, allow our all to be with You
Can we get through, we’re a part of You
 
Let us shine the light of love
Reminding us of who we are
Sai has come our love will grow
Guiding the world that we arrive
 
So divine is how we feel when we are with You
You fill our lives with the endless joy of love
Looking deep within our soul
We believe we’re a part of You
 
Sathya Sai, how we feel when we’re with You
Sacrifice, allow our all to be with You
Till we get through, till we’re a part of You
 
Let us shine the light of love
Reminding us of who we are
Sai has come our love will grow
Guiding the world that we arrive
 
So divine is how we feel when we are with You
You fill our lives with the endless joy of love
And when You speak the whole world is in tune

title: So do Thou my Lord
lyrics:
Thou and I, never apart.
 Wave of the sea, dissolve in the sea!
 I am the bubble, make me the sea.
 Make me the sea, O, make me the sea!
 I am the bubble, make me the sea.

title: So Great Is Krishna’s Divine Force
title2: So great is Krishna’s divine Force, truly, Sai Krishna is our Cosmic Source
lyrics:
Possible is everything, we just have to reach Krishna Sai Christ Lord
Knowing Sai Christ lives within, together Peace achieved 
Possible is everything, but all we must do, is to pray 
In the heart, in the heart, Pray keeps going (4)

title: Soham Soham Dhyan Karo
lyrics:
Sadguru Sai Dhyan Karo [ Soham Soham ... ]
Soham Brahma Soham Vishnu
Soham Sai Dhyana Karo
Soham Atma Shiva Paramatma
Brahmananda Se Hrudaya Bharo
meaning: Meditate on the divine word 'Soham' which means 'I am That'. Meditate on Sai who is our true and Divine Mentor. Soham is none other than Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva and the Atma (Higher self or Higher Conscience). Fill your hearts with Divine Bliss.

title: Somebody Loves You
title2: Somebody loves you more than you know
lyrics:
Somebody’s with you wherever you go
Somebody really and truly cares
And lovingly listens to all your prayers
Don’t doubt for a minute that this is our truth
For Sai loves His children and cares for them too
When all is precious for yours to share
If you love Him truly, then show Him that you care

title: Something beautiful is happening
title2: Something beautiful is happening to me, happening to me, happening to me
lyrics:
Something beautiful is happening to me, since I found the light of the Lord
 Something beautiful is happening to me, happening to me, happening to me
 Something beautiful is happening to me, and I'm walking in His way

title: Song To Honor Sathya Sai Baba
title2: Song To Honor Sathya Sai Baba
lyrics:
Sathya Sai, Poorna Avatar, known as Shirdi Sai a long time ago,
Divine vibhuti flows from His hand, bringing peace to all man.
The Godly glance fills all hearts, as His form silently speaks,
And once again He will appear, as Prema Sai Avatar.
Sathya Sai, Poorna Avatar (4x)

title: Song to the Lord
lyrics:
Sing to His divine perfection, to beloved Lord Sri Sathya Sai.
A glorious song of His protection, we'll bow to Sri Sathya Sai.

It is a joyous song I hear,
Sing it, O nightingale,
Your golden voice is near,
Yet far as the deepest vale.

Your chant is of His blissful grace,
As His precious footsteps fall,
He leads with a quiet pace,
As we hear His beloved call

(close)
Lord Sai is everywhere. (3x)

title: Sora ni Ukanda Shiroi Kumo
lyrics:
Akai Yuuhi ni Somari Yuku
Haha no Koromo no Iro ni Nite
Namida Afurete Tomedo Nashi
Ware mo Hitori Ko Kimi mo Mata
Fukaki Mimune ni Idakaren
Ah Sai Haha yo Mina Yobeba
Kodama Yasashii Sai Rama
Akai Yuuhi wo Abite Tatsu
Ware wa Hikari no Koto Naran
Itoshiki Haha no Furu Sato he
Omoi Todoke yo Kaze ni Nori
meaning: White clouds float in the sky. The evening sun comes and dyes the sky red. It becomes like the color of Mother Sai's clothes. My tears flow unceasingly at this sight. We become one with You again. You embrace us tightly in Your divine chest. O Mother Sai, we call out Your beautiful name. Sai Rama, Your kindness echoes throughout the land. I stand and bask in the evening sun, as I become a child of the light. I return to my place alongside my beloved mother, as my love for You rides through the wind.

title: Sora ni Ukanda Shiroi Kumo
lyrics:
Akai Yuuhi ni Somari Yuku
 Haha no Koromo no Iro ni Nite
 Namida Afurete Tomedo nashi
 Ware mo Hitorigo Kimi mo Mata
 Fukaki Mimune ni Idakaren
 Aa Sai Haha yo Mina Yobeba
 Kodama Yasashii Sai Rama
 Akai Yuuhi wo Abite Tatsu
 Ware wa Hikari no Ko to Naran
 Itoshiki Haha no Furusato e
 Omoi Todokeyo Kaze ni Nori

title: Sora Tobu Tori ni mo
lyrics:
Kami yo Kimi no Namae ga
Koni Saku Hana ni mo
Kami yo Kimi no sugata wa
Inochi no Uchi ni wa
Kami ga Mashimasu
Subete wa Kami nari
Watashi mo Kami nari
meaning: O Lord, You are the birds that fly in the sky, You are the flowers that bloom in the gardens, You are the very life within me. You make up everything that is, including me.

title: Soul of all souls
title2: Soul of all souls, how can anyone fail,
lyrics:
to surrender in Your Company
 I see You are the First
 The Origin of all creative causes
 The Master of all power
 The ultimate Domain of the realm of Nature
 The eternal Radiance
 The transcendental Self
 O, beloved Master, I bow down (3X)

title: Spread Your light
title2: Spread Your light that all may see, O Sathya Sai Baba
lyrics:
Some say You are Vishnu, some say You are Shiva
 You are my only love, O Kali Yuga Avathaar
 Spread Your joy that all may share, O Sathya Sai Baba
 Some say You were Rama, some say You were Krishna
 You are my only love, O Kali Yuga Avathaar
 Spread Your love that all may feel, O Sathya Sai Baba
 Some may call you Jesus, some may call You Allah
 You are my only love, O Kali Yuga Avathaar

title: Sri Annapoorne Sada Annapoorne
lyrics:
Sri Raja Rajeshwari Amba Sri Raja Rajeshwari 
Jaya Jagadambe Gnana Pradayini 
Jaya Bimbadhari Shanthi Pradayini 
Mata Maheshwari Mangala Dayini 
Parthi Pureeshwari Jaya Sai Janani 

(Amba) Sri Raja Rajeshwari (5)
meaning: Praise be to the Divine Mother, the one who provides us with spiritual nourishment and sustenance. She rules over the entire universe, and grants knowledge, peace, and auspiciousness. Bearing the crescent moon, she is verily our Lord Sai residing in Puttaparthi.

title: Sri Arunagiri Natha
lyrics:
Valli Nayaka Deena Sharanya 
Karuna Sagara Sri Karthikeya 
Sritha Jana Palaka Shiva Kumara 
Parthi Pureeshwara Pavana Charana 
Shiva Shiva Hara Hara Hara Hara Shiva Shiva Subrahmanya 

Subrahmanya Sharanam Sharanam Shanmukha Natha Sharanam Sharanam
Subrahmanya Sharanam Sharanam Skanda Kumara Swami Sharanam
Subrahmanya Sharanam Sharanam Parthi Pureesha Sai Sharanam (2)
meaning: Salutations to the holy feet of Lord Sai residing in Puttaparthi who is verily Lord Subrahmanya. Also known as Karthikeya, He is the son of Shiva (who resides in the Arunchala hill) and the Lord of Valli. He is the ocean of mercy, sustainer of His devotees, and the refuge of the impoverished. Surrender to Lord Subrahmanya.

title: Sri Gananatha Devadi Deva
lyrics:
Pranava Swaroopa Prabho Paahi
Pranava Swaroopa Prabho
Hey Shiva Nandana Bala Gajanana
Parvathi Tanaya Prabho Harey
Eshwari Tanaya Prabho Sai
Eshwari Tanaya Prabho
meaning: I seek your succor Oh Lord Ganesha, the supreme one among Gods, the one who is the primordial form, son of Lord Shiva and Mother Parvathi, you are none other than Sai, the son of Eshwaramba.

title: Sri Gananatha Jaya Gananatha
lyrics:
Sharanam Sharanam Gananatha (2) [ Sri Gananatha ... ]
Parvathi Nandana Bala Gajanana
Parthi Pureeshwara Sai Gajanana
Pashupathey Priya Sri Ganesha [ Sharanam Sharanam ... ]
meaning: I surrender to You, O Lord Ganesha the leader of ganaas (attendants of Lord Shiva). O son of Parvathi and the dear son of Lord Shiva, You are none other than Sai Gajanana residing in Parthi. I surrender to You.

title: Sri Ganapathi Hari Om
lyrics:
Ganapathi Hari Om Guna Nidhey Hari Om
Hari Om Ganapathi Hari Om
Varada Abhayakara Ananda Dayaka
Shiva Shakthi Nandana Om
Ganapathi Hari Om Guna Nidhey Hari Om [ Hari Om ... ]
meaning: Salutations to Lord Ganapath (Ganesha), the virtuous one, the one who destroys fears and bestows happiness, the son of Lord Shiva and Goddess Shakthi (Parvathi).

title: Sri Ganesha Charanam Sharanam Jai
title2: Sri Ganesha Charanam Sharanam Jai Ganesha Charanam
lyrics:
Parthi Pureesha Paapa Vinashaka [ Sri Ganesha Charanam ... ]
Abhaya Pradayaka Atma Swaroopa
Hey Shiva Nandana Jaya Jagadeesha
Buddhi Pradayaka Hey Shubha Dayaka 
Parthi Gajanana Pavana Charana
meaning: Let us surrender to the Lotus Feet of Lord Ganesha who is verily Lord Sai, Lord of Parthi, who destroys our sins. Salutations to the very embodiment of the Supreme Soul who grants us protection. Victory to the beloved son of Lord Shiva who bestows wisdom and auspiciousness. Salutations at the Holy Feet of Lord Ganesha at Parthi.

title: Sri Ganesha Jaya Ganesha
title2: Sri Ganesha Jaya Ganesha, Sadguru Deva Sai Ganesha
lyrics:
Parvathi Shankara Hey Paramesha
Rama Krishna Hari Govinda Vittala
Subrahmanyam Subrahmanyam Shanmukha Natha Subrahmanyam
Subrahmanyam Subrahmanyam Sai Natha Subrahmanyam
alt_lyrics:
Sri Ganesha Jaya Ganesha, Jai Guru Deva Sai Ganesha
Parvathi Nandana Hey Paramesha
Rama Krishna Hari Govinda Vittala
Subrahmanyam Subrahmanyam Shanmukha Natha Subrahmanyam (3)
Subrahmanyam Subrahmanyam Sai Natha Subrahmanyam
meaning: Glory to Lord Ganesha, son of Mother Parvathi and Lord Shiva. O Lord Ganesha, You are none other than Lord Sai. Chant the names of Rama, Krishna, Hari, Govinda, Vittala, Subrahmanya and Lord Sai.
deity: ganesha, rama, krishna, vittala, subrahmanya, guru

title: Sri Ganesha Jaya Ganesha Sathya
title2: Sri Ganesha Jaya Ganesha Sathya Sai Deva
lyrics:
Sadguru Sai Deva Jagat Guru Deva [ Sri Ganesha ... ]
Vighna Harana Dukha Harana Omkar Swaroopa
Sri Ganesha Deva Sathya Sai Deva
Mangala Kara Mangala Kara Sri Ganesha Deva
meaning: Glory to Lord Ganesh, and Lord Sai, the true and Universal Guru. He removes obstacles and sorrows. He bestows good fortune and is the embodiment of the life-force (om)

title: Sri Ganesha Shivuni Kumara Shritha
title2: Sri Ganesha Shivuni Kumara Shritha Jana Vinuta Prabho
lyrics:
Sri Gananatha Sevitha Paada (3)
Naagati Neevani Nammiti Sada
Nagabharana Nanu Daya Ganavaa [ Sri Ganesha ... ]

Iddari Tallula Muddu Kumara (3)
Bhakthuda Naiti Nee Vaddai Jerpara
Koddi Krupanu Naakosagi Brovara [ Sri Ganesha ... ]

Koggu Gamana Naa Dikku Niveraa (3)
Makkuvuto Na Madi Nilpitiraa
Akkara Seyaka Aadharincharaa [ Sri Ganesha ... ]

Sajjana Sadhula Sannuta Charana (3)
Kujja Deva Gajaasura Harana
Bojja Vishala Vijaya Gajanana [ Sri Ganesha ... ]

Sri Kailasapura Vighnesha (3)
Moravini Karunato Mammu Kaavamu Esha
Dvirada Vadana Shantha Prakasha [ Sri Ganesha ... ]

Sri Sayeeshuni Sevaka Janulamu (3)
Sai Bhajanalu Cheyuta Manayamu
Jayam Idarava Raayamuna Deva Bhakthulu Kaavaa [ Sri Ganesha ... ]
meaning: O Lord Ganesha, son of Shiva, please listen to our prayers; we pay our obeisance. I have always believed that You are my ultimate goal, O Ganesha, ornamented by a serpent. Please show Your compassion on me. O sweet son of two mothers (Parvathi and Ganga), we are Your devotees. Take us across the shore; please shower a little grace on us. O Ganesha, You who walk slowly are our only recourse. We sing Your name with great adoration. Do not delay our Lord, come and bless us. O elephant-faced one, You are worshipped by the upright and the seers. You are short in height, big bellied and always victorious, O the slayer of demon Gajasura. O destroyer of all obstacles, the resident of Kailasa, listen to our prayers with compassion. Come and bless us, O Lord, You have the body of two beings and You are glowing with peace. O Ganesha, we are the servants of Sai and we sing His songs. Have compassion on us and come quickly.

title: Sri Ganesha Sri Ganesha Sri
title2: Sri Ganesha Sri Ganesha Sri Ganesha Paahi Maam
lyrics:
Jai Ganesha Jai Ganesha Jai Ganesha Raksha Maam
Sri Ganesha Paahi Maam Jai Ganesha Raksha Maam
Jai Ganesha Jai Ganesha Jai Ganesha Raksha Maam
meaning: Victory to Thee, O Lord Ganesha. We pray to You to protect us.

title: Sri Ganesha Vinayaka
lyrics:
Vighna Vinashaka Vinayaka
Mangala Dayaka Vinayaka
Bhava Bhaya Nasha Vinayaka
Parthi Pureeshwara Vinayaka
meaning: Oh Lord Ganesha, remover of the fear of the materialistic world, you remove obstacles and grant auspiciousness, Oh Lord Vinayaka of Parthi.

title: Sri Gopala Gokula Bala
lyrics:
Tulasi Mala Sai Gopala [ Sri Gopala ... ]
Radha Vallabha Raasa Vilola [ Tulasi Mala ]
meaning: Pray to Lord Sai Gopala of Gokula who is the beloved of Radha. He wears an ornament made from the beads of holy Tulasi plant.

title: Sri Guru Jai Guru Sadguru
title2: Sri Guru Jai Guru Sadguru Sai
lyrics:
Satchidananda Sada Sukha Dayi [ Sri Guru ... ]
Amrutha Varshini Anandadayi
Atma Nivasini Sri Sathya Sai
meaning: Salutations to out true Guru, Sai, the personification of truth, knowledge and bliss. The indweller Mother Sai showers us with immortality and eternal bliss.

title: Sri Guru Jaya Guru Sai
title2: Sri Guru Jaya Guru Sai Guru Deva
lyrics:
Brahma Vishnu Shiva Guru Deva
Srishti Guru Sthithi Guru Laya Guru Deva
Siddha Guru Loka Guru Sathya Sai Deva
meaning: Glory be to Lord Sai, the universal teacher. He grants liberation and is the cause of creation, preservation, and dissolution.

title: Sri Guru Jaya Guru Sai
title2: Sri Guru Jaya Guru Sai Sadguru
lyrics:
Nithyananda Brahmananda Prema Sai Sadguru [ Sri Guru ... ]
Gnanopadesha Gnana Sai Sadguru
Vedopadesha Veda Sai Sadguru
Gitopadesha Murali Sai Sadguru
Karuna Kataksha Sathya Sai Sadguru (He)
meaning: Sai, the eternal teacher, is always full of love and bliss; He shows us the path of knowledge and gave us the Vedas and Gita. His glance is suffused with mercy and benevolence.

title: Sri Guru Paduka Stotram
lyrics:
Naukāyitābhyāṁ guru bhakthi dābhyām |
Vairāgya sāmrājyada pūjanābhyāṁ
Namō namaḥ śrīguru pādukābhyām ||  

Kavitva vārāśi niśākarābhyāṁ
Dourbhāgya dāvām budamālikābhyām |
Dūrī kr̥tā namra vipattitābhyāṁ
Namō namaḥ śrīguru pādukābhyām ||

Natā yayōḥ śrīpatitāṁ samīyuḥ
Kadācidapyāśu daridra varyāḥ |
Mūkāśca vācaspatitāṁ hi tābhyāṁ
Namō namaḥ śrīguru pādukābhyām ||

Nālīkanīkāśa padāhr̥tābhyāṁ
Nānā vimōhādi nivārikābhyām |
Namajjanābhīṣṭa tatipradābhyāṁ
Namō namaḥ śrīguru pādukābhyām ||

Nr̥pāli mauli vraja ratna kānti-
Sarid virājaj jhaṣa kan'yakābhyām |
Nr̥patva dābhyāṁ natalōka paṅktēḥ
Namō namaḥ śrīguru pādukābhyām ||

Pāpāndhakārārka paramparābhyāṁ
Tāpatrayāhīndra khagēśvarābhyām |
Jāḍyābdhi samśōṣaṇa vāḍavābhyāṁ
Namō namaḥ śrīguru pādukābhyām || 

Śamādi ṣaṭka prada vaibhavābhyāṁ
Samādhi dāna vrata dīkṣitābhyām |
Muktēhē hētusca sthira bhakthi dābhyāṁ
Namō namaḥ śrīguru pādukābhyām ||

Svārcā parāṇām akhilēṣṭa dābhyāṁ
Svāhā sahāyākṣa dhurandharābhyām |
Svāntāccha bhāva prada pūjanābhyāṁ
Namō namaḥ śrīguru pādukābhyām ||

Kāmādi sarpavraja gārudābhyām
Vivēka vairāgya nidhi pradābhyām |
Bōdha pradābhyāṁ druta mōkṣadābhyāṁ
Namō namaḥ śrīguru pādukābhyām ||

--------- Guru Paduka Stotram ---------
meaning:
1. It helps to cross the endless ocean of samsara (worldly existence), becoming a boat, and it confers devotion to the Guru. Worshipping them, one reaches the dominion of renunciation itself. Salutations again and again unto the holy Padukas (sandals) of the Guru.
 
2. For the surging ocean of knowledge, it is like the full moon. For the fire of misfortunes, it is the cluster of clouds that showers rain. For those who worship them, they remove all adversities. Salutations again and again unto the holy Padukas of the Guru.
 
3. Prostrating to them, they have become prosperous instantly, even those that were wallowing in poverty. And the mute ones are transformed into eloquent orators. Salutations again and again unto the holy Padukas of the Guru.
 
4. Attracting one to the (Guru's) feet that are like a bouquet of lotuses. Removing the multitudes of desires that are born of delusion. They fulfil all the wishes of those that bow in submission. Salutations again and again unto the holy Padukas of the Guru.
 
5. They shine like the gem that adorns a king's crown. Like a charming damsel in a fish infested large river. Sovereignty is conferred on the array of devotees that bow before them Salutations again and again unto the holy Padukas of the Guru.
 
6. They are like the Sun that destroy the endless darkness of sins. To the serpent of the triad miseries (caused by self, others and nature), they are like the King of Birds (Garuda). They are the conflagration that dries up the ocean of ignorance. Salutations again and again unto the holy Padukas of the Guru.
 
7. They confer the six kinds of prosperity (shat-sampatti) that begins with control of the mind. They are bound by the vow to lead the initiated to Samadhi. They are the source of liberation and conferrers of steady devotion. Salutations again and again unto the holy Padukas of the Guru.
 
8. They fulfil all wishes of those that are ever ready to serve and focussed on helping the ones in need, And bestow purity of heart when worshipped. Salutations again and again unto the holy Padukas of the Guru.
 
9. To the serpents of vices led by lust (the six inner enemies), they are like Garuda. They bless with the treasures of discrimination and dispassion. They confer knowledge and instantly grant liberation. Salutations again and again unto the holy Padukas of the Guru.
raga: shivaranjani, shuddha saveri / durga, kalyani / yaman

title: Sri Guru Parthi Vasa
lyrics:
Sai Brahma Vishnu Mahesha [ Sri Guru ... ]
Allah Bhi Tum Ho Maulah Bhi Tum Ho
Zohrashtra Mahavira Yesu Bhi Tum Ho
Ram Rahim Ho Krishna Karim Ho
meaning: Chant the name of Lord of Parthi who is Guru, Brahma, Vishnu, Mahesha, Allah, Zohrashtra, Mahavira and He is also none other than Rama, Krishna and Karim.

title: Sri Hari Bol Sri Hari
title2: Sri Hari Bol Sri Hari Bol Mukunda Madhava Hari Hari Bol
lyrics:
Ek Prabhu Ke Aneka Naam Prema Se Bolo Sai Bhagawan
Sai Bhagawan Bolo Sai Bhagawan
meaning: Chant Hari's name who is also called Mukunda and Madhava. There is one God, but He has many names. He is also known by the name Sai Baba. Chant Lord Sai's name with love.

title: Sri Hari Jaya Hari Nanda
title2: Sri Hari Jaya Hari Nanda Mukunda Hari
lyrics:
Radha Ramana Hari Narayana
Narayana Hari ( Sai ) Narayana
meaning: Salutations to Sri Hari who is also Lord Narayana and beloved of Radha.

title: Sri Hari Nanda Mukunda Harey
lyrics:
Dasharatha Nandana Rama Harey [ Sri Hari ... ]
Geeta Prabodhana Srivatsalanchana
Asura Nikhanda Ravana Mardhana
Alakha Niranjana Rama Harey
Rama Harey Sita (Sai) Rama Harey
Raghupathi Raghava Rama Harey [ Dasharatha Nandana ... ]
meaning: Chant the names Lord Hari (Krishna), Nanda's son and the name of Dasaratha's son, Lord Rama, in whose heart Goddess Lakshmi resides. O Rama, destroyer of many demons like Ravana, You are purity personified. Chant the name of Lord Sai who is verily Lord Rama.

title: Sri Hari Sai Gurudeva
lyrics:
Raghava Krishna Mahadeva [ Sri Hari ... ]
Deena Jano Ke Ho Tuma Taraka
Prema Sagara Patitodharaka
Sharana Me Leylo Gnana Pradayaka
meaning: True Guru Lord Sai grants wisdom, and is an ocean of love. He is the star of hope to the weak. He is Rama, Krishna, Shiva, and Vishnu. Please, Sai grant me refuge.

title: Sri Krishna Govinda Harey Murare
lyrics:
He Natha Narayana Vasudeva
Sri Krishna Govinda Harey Murarey [ He Natha ... ]
meaning: Chant the names of Lord Krishna: Govinda, Murari, Narayana, and Vasudeva.

title: Sri Krishna Krishna Ghana Sundar
title2: Sri Krishna Krishna Ghana Sundar Ghana Shyama Shyama Muralidhar
lyrics:
Ghana Shyama Shyama Kamalavar Sri Krishna Krishna Yamunavar
Sri Krishna Krishna Natanagar Ghana Shyama Shyama Jagadeeshwar
Barsana Mey Kunja Vihari, Brindavan Mey Hey Giridhari, Parthi Mey Chitta Chora Murari, Hrudaya Vihari
Sri Krishna Krishna Karunakar Ghana Shyama Shyama Sayeeshwar
(Hey) Nanda Kishora Navaneetha Chora Sai Shyama Sukh Sagar

Ghana Sundar, Muralidhar, Kamalavar, Yamunavar
Natanagar, Jagadeeshwar, Karunakar, Sayeeshwar
meaning: Sing in praise of Sai Krishna, who is as beautiful as the dark stormy sky. He plays the flute and resides in our hearts, stealing the butter of our ignorance. The benevolent bestower of peace, He invests divine energy in maintaining the garden of our heart. As our protector, He has lifted mountains for us and slayed demons (like Mura).

title: Sri Krishna Sri Rama
title2: Sri Krishna Sri Rama Sri Bhagavaan
lyrics:
You show us the way of the Truth and the Light
 Sri Krishna Sri Rama Sri Bhagavaan
 Our hearts are made pure by Thy beautiful Sight
 You show us that God is within everyone
 Sri Krishna Sri Rama Sri Bhagavaan

title: Sri Krishnashtakam
title2: Vasudēva sutaṃ dēvaṃ kaṃsa cāṇūra mardanam
lyrics:
Dēvakī paramānandaṃ kṛṣṇaṃ vandē jagadgurum ॥

Atasī puṣpa saṅkāśam hāranūpura śōbhitam
Ratnakaṅkaṇa kēyūraṃ kṛṣṇaṃ vandē jagadgurum ॥

Kuṭilālaka saṃyuktaṃ pūrṇa candra nibhānanam
Vilasat kuṇḍaladharaṃ kṛṣṇaṃ vandē jagadgurum ॥

Mandāra gandha saṃyuktaṃ cāruhāsaṃ caturbhujam
Barhipiñchāva cūḍāṅgaṃ kṛṣṇaṃ vandē jagadgurum ॥

Utphulla padmapatrākṣaṃ nīlajīmūta sannibham
Yādavānāṃ śirōratnaṃ kṛṣṇaṃ vandē jagadgurum ॥

Rukmiṇīkēli saṃyuktaṃ pītāmbara suśōbhitam
Avāpta tulasīgandhaṃ kṛṣṇaṃ vandē jagadgurum ॥

Gōpikānāṃ kucadvandva kuṅkumāṅkitavakṣasam
Śrīnikētaṃ mahēṣvāsaṃ kṛṣṇaṃ vandē jagadgurum ॥

Śrīvatsāṅkaṃ mahōraskaṃ vanamālā virājitam
Śaṅkha cakradharaṃ dēvaṃ kṛṣṇaṃ vandē jagadgurum ॥

Kṛṣṇāṣṭakamidaṃ puṇyaṃ prātarutthāya yaḥ paṭhēt
Kōṭi janma kṛtaṃ pāpaṃ smaraṇēna vinaśyati ॥

--------- Krishnashtakam ---------
meaning:
1. The Lord, the Son of Vasudeva and the vanquisher of Kamsa and Chanura. The supreme bliss of Devaki, salutations to Krishna, the Universal Preceptor.
 
2. Whose appearance is like that of the Atasi (flax) flower, adorned with garlands, anklets, bracelets and armlets, salutations to Krishna, the Universal Preceptor.
 
3. The One with curly locks and a face resembling the full-moon, wearing earrings that glitter playfully, salutations to Krishna, the Universal Preceptor.
 
4. The One with the fragrance of the Mandara flowers, a charming smile and four hands, with a peacock feather adorning the head, salutations to Krishna, the Universal Preceptor.
 
5. Whose eyes are like a wide-open lotus leaf, who resembles a blue cloud, crest-jewel of the Yadavas, salutations to Krishna, the Universal Preceptor.
 
6. Playful in the company of Rukmini, He is resplendently dressed in yellow silk, having the fragrance of Tulasi (basil leaves), salutations to Krishna, the Universal Preceptor.
 
7. One whose chest is smeared by the vermilion that the Gopis apply to theirs. The abode of all wealth & prosperity, the great Archer, salutations to Krishna, the Universal Preceptor.
 
8. Whose broad chest bears the Srivatsa mark, adorned with a garland of forest flowers, the Lord who bears the conch and discus, salutations to Krishna, the universal preceptor.
 
9. Whoever, after waking up in the morning, recites this sacred octet on Krishna (Krishnashtakam), through that remembrance, sins accrued over a crore lifetimes shall be destroyed.

title: Sri Lakshmi Ramana Narayana
lyrics:
Narayana Veda Parayana [ Sri Lakshmi ... ]
Bhava Bhaya Harana Vanditha Charana
Alakh Niranjana Narayana
Vaidehi Mohana Narayana (2)
meaning: Salutation to Lord Narayana who is the beloved of Goddess Lakshmi. Salutations to the one who has knowledge of all the Vedas, the one who removes the fear of the materialistic world, whose feet are worshipped by all, who is always pure and who has enchanted Vaidehi (Sita) as Lord Rama.

title: Sri Madhusudhana Krishna Giridhara Shyama
title2: Sri Madhusudhana Krishna Giridhara Shyama Murari
lyrics:
Bhaktha Vatsala Prabhu Hey Giridhari
Radha Ramana Sri Hari
Keshava Madhava Sadhu Samrakshaka
Sai Krishna Murari
meaning: O Lord Krishna, You are adored by Your devotees as well as Your beloved Radha. O Lord who lifted the Govardhana hill, You are saviour of the holy men and ascetics.

title: Sri Madhusudhana Krishna Krishna
lyrics:
Devaki Vasudeva Krishna Krishna
Sri Jagannatha Krishna Krishna
Nanda Yashoda Krishna Krishna
Sri Sai Natha Krishna Krishna (2)
meaning: Glory to the annihilator of demon Madhu, Lord Krishna, the son of Devaki and Vasudeva. Glory to the Lord of this Universe. You are also the charming lad of mother Yashoda and King Nanda. O Lord Sai, You are none other than Lord Krishna.

title: Sri Mallikarjuna Maheshwara
lyrics:
Shiva Sai Shambho Vishweshwara [ Sri Mallikarjuna ... ]
Srisaila Vasa Sureshwara
Sri Bhramaramba Hrudayeshwara
Parvathi Ramana Parameshwara
meaning: This song praises Lord Shiva, the presiding deity in Srisailam, in Andhra Pradesh State in India, who is the Consort of Parvathi, with various names and attributes such as, Mallikarjuna, Vishweshwara, Sri Shaila Vasa, the one who resides in the heart of Bhramaramba (Parvathi's name in Srisailam).

title: Sri Mata Jaganmata
lyrics:
Sai Mata Shashi Gowri Mata
Dharani Mata Paripoorani Mata
Jagadharani Mata Bhava Haarini Mata
meaning: O Mother Sai, the mother of the Universe, the mother of auspiciousness, the one who fulfills all our wishes and liberate us from this materialistic world, who is none other than the Mother Earth, our salutations to You.

title: Sri Purandara Sai Vittala
lyrics:
Sri Hari Madhava Govinda Vittala [ Sri Purandara ... ]
Pandari Natha Panduranga Vittala
Bhaktha Samrakshaka Sri Krishna Vittala
Parthi Purandara Sai Ranga Vittala
meaning: Chant the name of Vittala of Pandari (Lord Krishna). He is Lord Sai, the savior of His devotees and the resident of Puttaparthi.

title: Sri Raghu Nandana Bhava Bhaya
title2: Sri Raghu Nandana Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana
lyrics:
Sita Pathey Ramachandra (Hey)
Parama Pavitra Varija Netra
Jagadodhara Nirakara [ Sita Pathey ... ]
Ahalyodhara Sabari Raghuraya
Raghukula Bhooshana Rajeeva Lochana [ Sita Pathey ... ]
meaning: O Lord Rama, You are the ornament of Raghu Dynasty, You are the destroyer of fear of this materialistic world. O Lord of Mother Sita, Your eyes are like Lotus. O the Formless one, the upholder of the Universe, the one who liberated Ahalya from a curse, our salutations to You.

title: Sri Raghu Nandana Dasharatha Nandana
lyrics:
Bhadradeeshwara Rama
Vaidehi Priya Vaikunta Vasa
Sada Smarami Ramethi Rama
meaning: Chant incessantly the holy name of Rama from Raghu Dynasty. He is the son of King Dasharatha and who is the presiding deity in Bhadrachalam (a holy place). He is the beloved of Vaidehi (Sita) and the one who resides in Vaikunta (the abode of Lord Vishnu).

title: Sri Raghu Nandana Janaki Jeevana
lyrics:
Rama Rama Rama Sai (Ram)
Alakh Niranjana Asura Nikhandana
Rajeeva Lochana Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana [ Rama Rama ... ]
meaning: Worship Lord Rama, who is the consort of Janaki (Sita), who is always pure, the slayer of demons, the one with eyes like Lotus and who destroys the fear of the materialistic world.

title: Sri Raghu Nandana Rama Harey
lyrics:
Hey Yadu Nandana Krishna Harey
Vaidehi Priya Rama Harey
Radha Ramana Shyama Harey
meaning: Glory to Lord Rama of Raghu dynasty and the beloved of Mother Sita. Glory to Lord Krishna of Yadu dynasty and the beloved of Radha.

title: Sri Raghu Nandana Sita Rama
lyrics:
Rajeeva Lochana Raja Rama
Raja (Sai) Rama
Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana Taraka Naama
Atma Rama Sai Rama
Kalimala Bhanjana Kodanda Rama
meaning: Worship Lord Rama of Raghu Dynasty, the consort of Sita, the one with lotus eyes, the one whose sacred name destroys the fear of the materialistic world and grants liberation, the one who is Atma Rama (inner self or higher conscience), the one who wields the bow named "Kodanda" and the one who destroys the impurities of the age of Kali. He is verily Lord Sai.

title: Sri Ram Jaya Ram Jaya
title2: Sri Ram Jaya Ram Jaya Jaya Ram (2)
lyrics:
Sri Ram Jaya Ram Jaya Sai Ram
Sri Ram Jaya Ram Sri Ram Jaya Ram Sathya Sai Ram
meaning: Chant the glory of Lord Rama. Victory to Lord Sathya Sai Ram.

title: Sri Ram Jaya Ram Jaya
title2: Sri Ram Jaya Ram Jaya Jaya Ram Janaki Jeevana Ram
lyrics:
Patitha Pavana Rama Harey Jaya Raghava Sundara Ram
Deenodharana Rama Harey Jaya Maruti Sevitha Ram
Jaya Jaya Ram Jaya Raghu Ram Janaki Jeevana Ram
meaning: Victory to Lord Rama, the embodiment of auspiciousness, the very life of Janaki (Sita) the uplifter of downtrodden, the beautiful one from Raghu dynasty, who sanctifies the sinners and the one who is worshipped by Maruti (Hanuman).

title: Sri Ram Jaya Ram Jaya Jaya Ram
title2: Sri Ram Jaya Ram Jaya Jaya Ram
lyrics:
Raghupathi Raghava Raja Ram
Dasharatha Nandana Sri Raghu Ram
Parthi Pureeshwara Sai Ram [ Raghupathi Raghava ... ]
meaning: Victory to Lord Rama, the descendant of the Raghu clan, the son of Dasharatha. Victory to Lord Sai, Lord of Parthi, who is none other than Lord Rama.

title: Sri Rama Charanam Smaramyaham
lyrics:
Sthira Sukha Dayaka Sai Charanam [ Sri Rama ... ]
Shritha Jana Palaka Shirdi Charanam
Srikara Shubha Kara Parthi Charanam
meaning: Worship the feet of Sri Rama, which bestows eternal bliss, the feet of Shirdi Sai, which bestows austerity to those who worship them and the feet of Sai of Puttaparthi, which bestows wealth and prosperity.

title: Sri Rama Charanam Sri Rama
title2: Sri Rama Charanam Sri Rama Charanam Sri Rama Charanam Bhajey (2)
lyrics:
Vaidehi Ramam Vaikunta Dhamam
Bhoopala Choodamani
Atmabhi Ramam Prabhu Sai Ramam
Sri (Sathya Sai) Rama Charanam Bhajey (3)
meaning: Worship the feet of Lord Sri Rama, Lord of Vaidehi, whose abode is Vaikunta. Like the Choodamani, which is the best among the jewels worn on the head, Sri Rama is the Crown Jewel among the kings who have ruled this world. He is the Atma (Higher self or Higher conscience) Rama, Sathya Sai Rama.

title: Sri Rama Daasa Rama Dootha
title2: Sri Rama Daasa Rama Dootha Jai Bolo Hanuman Ki
lyrics:
Rama Bhaktha Rama Priyakara 
Jai Bolo Hanuman Ki
meaning: Glory be to Lord Hanuman, the messenger, devotee, servant of Lord Rama.

title: Sri Rama Dootha Jaya Hanuman
lyrics:
Anjani Putra Jaya Hanuman
Ati Balavanta Jaya Hanuman
Jaya Hanuman (2) Jai Jai Hanuman Jaya Hanuman
Jaya Hanuman Jai Jaya Hanuman (2)
meaning: Glory to Lord Hanuman, the son of Mother Anjana. Victory to the foremost devotee of Lord Rama. Victory to the one who possesses immense strength.

title: Sri Rama Jaya Rama
lyrics:
Daasharathey Jaya Raghu Rama
Kalyana Rama Kodanda Rama
Sita Rama Sri Raghu Rama
Sri Ram Jaya Ram
Sri Rama Jaya Rama Sathya Sai Rama
meaning: Victory to Lord Rama of Raghu dynasty, the son of Dasharatha and the consort of Mother Sita. Victory to the one who wields the Kodanda bow and who bestows welfare on all. Victory to Lord Sathya Sai who is verily Lord Rama.

title: Sri Rama Jaya Rama
lyrics:
Hey Bhaava Priya Sai Rama (2)
Sathya Priya Dharma Priya
Shanthi Priya Prema Priya [ Hey Bhaava Priya ... ]
meaning: Victory to Sri Rama who responds to a devotee's yearning. You are Sai Rama of Prashanthi Nilayam, the one who is fond of truth, righteousness, peace and divine love.

title: Sri Rama Jaya Rama
title2: Sri Rama Jaya Rama Jaya Jaya Ram
lyrics:
Govinda Gopala Hey Ghana Shyam
Sundara Shyam Nayanabhi Ram
Madhura Manohara Sai Bhagawan
meaning: Victory to the Lord Rama, the beautiful lotus-eyed one and Lord Gopala (Krishna), the beautiful dark-hued one who is the protector of cows. Victory to Lord Sai, the sweetest and most pleasing Lord.

title: Sri Rama Jaya Rama Jaya
title2: Sri Rama Jaya Rama Jaya Jaya Rama
lyrics:
Sri Rama Jaya Rama Sundara Rama [ Sri Rama ... ]
Sri Rama Jaya Rama Mangala Naama
Sri Rama Jaya Rama Atma Rama
Sri Rama Jaya Rama Sita (Sai) Rama
meaning: Victory to Lord Rama, the most beautiful one whose name is auspicious, the one who is the indweller, Atma Rama (Higher conscience or Higher Self). Victory to Lord Sai who is none other than Lord Rama.

title: Sri Rama Naamam Ramaneeya Naamam
lyrics:
Sundara Ramam Sugunabhi Ramam [ Sri Rama ... ]
Munijana Vanditha Mohana Ramam
Janaki Ramam Jagadabhi Ramam
Taraka Naamam Sathya Sai Naamam [ Sundara Rama ... ]
meaning: Oh Lord Rama, your name is as enchanting as your form. You are beautiful and full of divine qualities worshipped by sages and pious people You are the Consort of Janaki and the Lord of Universe Sai Rama! Your name provides deliverance from sins. (Taraka Naamam)

title: Sri Rama Namostuthey Sai Krishna
title2: Sri Rama Namostuthey Sai Krishna Namostuthey
lyrics:
Shirdi Sai Namostuthey
Parthi Baba Namostuthey
Namostuthey Namostuthey
Sai Krishna Namostuthey
meaning: We worship and chant Sri Rama and Sri Krishna who is also residing in Shirdi and Parthi.

title: Sri Rama Raghu Nandana Ghana
title2: Sri Rama Raghu Nandana Ghana Shyama Yadu Nandana
lyrics:
Sri Ranga Nanda Nandana Sri Ranga Nanda Nandana
Ananda Nanda Gopi Ranjana Niranjana
Sri Rama Raghu Nandana
Ghana Shyama Yadu Nandana
meaning: Chant the holy name of Sri Rama who is of Raghu dynasty. He is none other than Ghana Shyama, Yadu Nandana, Sri Ranga (All names of Vishnu and Krishna) bestowing bliss and the one who is adored by Gopikas.

title: Sri Rama Rama Raja Ram
lyrics:
Jaya Jaya Jaya Ram Jaya Sai Ram
Sri Rama Ram Sita Ram [ Jaya Jaya ... ]
Sri Rama Ram Janaki Ram [ Jaya Jaya ... ]
meaning: Glory be to Lord Rama, Lord of Janaki, and to Lord Sai.

title: Sri Rama Rama Ram Yadu
title2: Sri Rama Rama Ram Yadu Nandana Hey Ghana Shyam
lyrics:
Sri Ram Jaya Ram Jaya Jaya Ram (3)
Raghupathi Raghava Raja Ram
Patitha Pavana Sita Ram [ Sri Ram Jaya Ram ... ]
meaning: Sing the name of Rama, who is beloved of Sita and son of Dasharatha and star of Raghu clan. Fill the mind with the glory of Rama, who sanctifies the sinners. Repeat the name of Sai Ram.

title: Sri Rama Rama Rama Raghuveera
title2: Sri Rama Rama Rama Raghuveera Rama Ram
lyrics:
Sri Rama Rama Rama Bharatagraja Rama Ram
Sri Rama Rama Rama Ranadheera Rama Ram
Sri Rama Rama Rama Sharanam Tava Rama Ram
meaning: I surrender to Thee, O valorous Lord Rama of the Raghu Dynasty, the one who is the elder brother of Bharata.

title: Sri Rama Rama Rama Sita
title2: Sri Rama Rama Rama Sita Rama Raghava (2)
lyrics: Narayana Hari Narayana (3)
meaning: Chant the various names of Rama - Sita Rama, Raghava, Narayana.

title: Sri Rama Sai Rama Jaya
title2: Sri Rama Sai Rama Jaya Jaya Rama
lyrics:
Hey Rama O Rama Omkara Rama
Parabrahma Param Dhama Prashanthi Rama
Shirdeesha Partheesha Sadguru Rama
meaning: Victory to Lord Sai Rama of Shirdi and Parthi. He is the true Guru (Preceptor). He is the embodiment of 'Om'. He is verily the Supreme Soul whose abode is Prashanthi Nilayam.

title: Sri Rama Sri Raghu Rama
lyrics:
Sri Rama Sita Rama [ Sri Rama ... ]
Sri Rama Megha Shyama
Sri Rama Sai Rama
meaning: Glory to Lord Rama of Raghu dynasty, the consort of Sita. Glory to the one who is the color of the rain-cloud. Lord Sai is none other than Lord Rama.

title: Sri Rama Sundara Naama
lyrics:
Raghu Rama Taraka Naama [ Sri Rama ... ]
Dasharatha Nandana Sri Rama
Dharma Samrakshaka Sugunabhi Rama
Kalimala Bhanjana Kodanda Rama
Karuna Sagara Kalyana Rama
meaning: The name Rama is beautiful and provides deliverance from sins. Rama, the son of King Dasharatha has come to uphold righteousness and is noble. He gives succor to sins of the Kali age, is ocean of compassion and auspiciousness.

title: Sri Ramachandra Jaya Jagannatha
lyrics:
Sita Pathey Jaya Raghu Natha
Patitha Pavana Deena Natha
Deena Natha Deena Natha [ Patitha Pavana ... ]
Parthi Pureeshwara Sai Natha [ Sita Pathey ... ]
meaning: Worship Lord Rama, who is the Lord of the whole world and of the Raghu Dynasty, the consort of Sita, the one who sanctifies the sinners and who is verily the Lord of Parthi - Lord Sai.

title: Sri Ramachandra Jaya Ramachandra
lyrics:
Raghuveera Ranadheera Raghukula Rama [ Sri Ramachandra ... ]
Dasharatha Nandana Dayabhi Rama
Danava Bhanjana Kodanda Rama
Kalyana Rama Kamaneeya Rama [ Raghuveera ... ]
meaning: Victory to Lord Rama, the valiant hero of the battlefield, the son of Dasharatha. Lord Rama is the most compassionate one, the slayer of demons, the wielder of the sacred bow Kodanda, one who does good to everyone and who is very attractive to look at.

title: Sri Ranga Harey Vittala Sai
title2: Sri Ranga Harey Vittala Sai Ranga Harey Vittala
lyrics:
Hey Daya Nidhey Vittala Hey Krupa Nidhey Vittala
Hey Sai Prabho Vittala Sathya Sai Prabho Vittala
meaning: Glory to Lord Vittala who is all compassionate and merciful. Salutations to Lord Sathya Sai who is verily Lord Vittala.

title: Sri Ranga Sai Shesha Sai
lyrics:
Sevitha Mohana Sri Sathya Sai [ Sri Ranga ... ]
Karunalaya Sri Ranga Sai
Kamaneeyanana Sri Sathya Sai [ Sri Ranga ... ]
Jaya Jaya Govinda Govardhana Sai
Jaya Jaya Gopala Vanditha Sai
meaning: Sri Ranga is all charming and Lord Sai is resting on serpent "Sesha". He is all compassionate and worshipped in different forms as Sri Ranga, Govinda, holder of Govardhana mountain, Mother Sai and Gopala. He is all attractive, charming Lord Sai.

title: Sri Ranga Sri Ranga Ranga
title2: Sri Ranga Sri Ranga Ranga Ranga Sri Ranga (2)
lyrics:
Kaveri Thata Vasa Kasturi Ranga
Karunya Lavanya Karunanta Ranga
Jaya Panduranga Jaya Sai Ranga (2)
meaning: Chant the name of Lord Sriranga (Narayana) who resides on the banks of river Kaveri and who adorns the fragrant musk. He is compassionate and His beauty is enchanting. Victory to You, O Lord Panduranga who is none other than Sai.

title: Sri Ranga Vittala Pandari Natha
title2: Sri Ranga Vittala Pandari Natha Vittala ( Jaya )
lyrics:
Sri Ranga Panduranga Sai Ranga Vittala [ Sri Ranga Vittala ... ]
Rakumayi Vittala Radhey Shyam Vittala
Dwarakamayi Vittala Purandara Vittala [ Sri Ranga Panduranga ... ]
meaning: Salutations to Lord Vittala of Pandari, the consort of Rakumayi and the beloved of Radha. He is also the Vittala of Dwarakamayi (Shirdi Sai).

title: Sri Ranga Vittala Vittala Narayana
lyrics:
Panduranga Vittala Vittala Narayana
Rakumayi Vittala Vittala Narayana
Dwarakamayi Vittala Vittala Narayana
Sri Sai Vittala Vittala Narayana
meaning: Pray to Lord Vittala who is none other than Lord Narayana. He is Lord Panduranga and the beloved of Rakumayi. He is also Lord Sai, the resident of Dwarakamayi in Shirdi.

title: Sri Rangana Krishnana Devaki Nandana
lyrics:
Kamala Nayana Shyamala Vadana Ananda Chandana [ Sri Rangana ... ]
Venu Vilolana Gopika Ranjana Yashoda Nandana
Ananda Chandana
Yashoda Nandana
meaning: Glory to Thee O Lord Ranganatha, Krishna, the son of Devaki. With Your lotus eyes, body of dark complexion, with the flute in Your hand, You are happiness personified, O son of Yashoda.

title: Sri Sai Charanam Sathya Sai
title2: Sri Sai Charanam Sathya Sai Charanam
lyrics:
Prabhu Sai Charanam Namasthey Namasthey
Ramaya Charanam Krishnaya Charanam
Saishwaraya Namasthey Namasthey
Sri Guru Charanam Sadguru Charanam [ Prabhu Sai ... ]
meaning: Salutation at the feet of Lord Rama, Krishna, Sai, the Lord of Parthi.

title: Sri Sai Gananayakam Ganapathim
lyrics:
Bhaktha Jana Vanditham Pavanam [ Sri Sai ... ]
Vidya Buddhi Pradayaka Devam
Bhava Bhaya Haranam Bhavani Tanayam
meaning: Salutations to Lord Ganapathi (Ganesha), who is the Lord of Ganaas (attendants of Lord Shiva). He is worshipped by His devotees who are sanctified by His grace. O son of Bhavani (Parvathi), You are the provider of knowledge, education and the one who dispels fear of sins and cycle of birth and death. You are none other than Lord Sai.

title: Sri Sai Natha Deena Natha
lyrics:
Parthi Puri Bhagawan
Shantha Swaroopa Premavatara
Karuna Swaroopa Bhagawan
Rajeeva Lochana Ananda Rama
Mangala Nayanabhi Ram
meaning: Salutations to the Lord of Parthi, the compassionate Lord of the needy and downtrodden, the personification of Peace, Mercy, the one with lotus eyes, which bestow auspiciousness.

title: Sri Sai Natha Guru Govinda
lyrics:
Parthi Pureeshwara Jaya Govinda
Prashanthi Nilaya Radhey Govinda
Sri Guru Jaya Guru Vittala Govinda
meaning: Sing the name of Lord Sai who is our Guru, the Lord Govinda who resides in Parthi/Prashanthi Nilayam, the Lord of Radha and also known by the name of Vittala.

title: Sri Sai Rama Harey Sri
title2: Sri Sai Rama Harey Sri Sai Rama Harey
lyrics:
Sri Rama Chandra Prabhu Rama Chandra
Sai (Sri) Rama Chandra Harey (3)
meaning: Worship Sai Rama who is also the Lord Rama.

title: Sri Sai Rama Sundara Naama
lyrics:
Pavana Charana Prashanthi Rama
Jagadashraya Bhava Bandha Vimochana
Ahalyodharaka Rama Harey
Rama Harey Rama Harey
Parthi Pureesha Mangala Dhama
Pavana Charana Prashanthi Rama
meaning: O Lord Sai Rama of Prashanthi, from whom the entire world seeks solace and liberation, You are none other than the Lord Rama who liberated Ahalya. O Lord of Parthi, we offer our salutations at Your sacred feet.

title: Sri Sai Sharanam Sharanam Deva
lyrics:
Sadguru Mama Guru Sharanam Deva [ Sri Sai ... ]
Guru Sakshath Parabrahma Deva
Guru Vishnu Guru Maheshwara Deva
Sadguru Charanam Sharanam Deva (2)
meaning: I surrender at the feet of my Divine preceptor, Sai, who is none other than the all pervading Parabrahma (The Supreme Cosmic Spirit). HE is Trinity (Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva) combined in one form.

title: Sri Sai Shirdeeshwara Parthi Vasa
title2: Sri Sai Shirdeeshwara Parthi Vasa Parameshwara
lyrics:
Patitha Pavana Bhava Bhaya Bhanjana Lokesha Bhaktha Palana [ Sri Sai ... ]
Jaalileda Deena Bandhava
Chaala Mela Jagat Bandhava
Bhaktha Hrudayalaya Srishti Sthithi Laya Sathya Dharma Shanthi Premalaya [ Sri Sai ... ]
Paahi Paahi Parameshwara Jata Joota Shambho Shankara
Trishoola Dhara Trinetra Dhari Girija Kantha Sadashiva
meaning: Oh Sai of Shirdi and Parthi, You are none other than Lord Shiva who gives succor to your devotees. Oh compassionate Lord, show Your mercy without delay, You are the cause for the Creation, Existence and Dissolution and the one who establishes Truth, Righteousness, Peace and Love in this universe. Please come to protect us, Oh compassionate Parameshwara (Lord Shiva) with Your matted hair, Trident in hand, having three eyes and accompanied by Your Consort Girija (Parvathi).

title: Sri Sathya Sai Our Heavenly Host
title2: Sri Sathya Sai our heavenly host
lyrics:
He’s the one I adore the most
But it doesn’t matter what name you say
Call on the name of the Lord
 
Krishna, Buddha, Jesus, Sai
It doesn’t matter what name you cry
As long as you call He will hear
Call on the name of the Lord
 
Remember the form of the Lord you love
And whatever troubles and trials that come
The Lord will guide you safely through
Call on the name of the Lord
 
Sri Sathya Sai is the one I love
The one I want to know
But it doesn’t matter what name you say
Call on the name of the Lord

title: Sri Vasudeva Narayana
lyrics:
Govinda Gopala Narayana
Janardhana Madhusudhana
Madhusudhana Madhusudhana [ Janardhana ... ]
Govardhanodhara Gopalana
Sri Sai Govinda Madhava Keshava
meaning: Worship the Lord Hari who is known by many names as Vasudeva, Narayana, Janardhana, Madhusudhana, Gopalana, Madhava, Keshava. Worship Lord Sai who is the very incarnation of Lord Hari.

title: Sri Vasudeva Narayana Sai Narayana
lyrics:
Janardhana Hey Madhusudhana Sai Narayana
Govardhanodhara Gopalana Sai Narayana
Hari Om Hari Om Hari Om Narayana
meaning: Worship and chant the Holy names of Lord Krishna - Vasudeva, Janardhana, Madhusudhana and Narayana who as Gopala had lifted  the Govardhana mountain to protect His devotees. Lord Sai is verily Lord Narayana.

title: Sri Venkatesha Sayeeshwara
lyrics:
Tirumalai Vasa Sayeeshwara
Sayeeshwara Sathya Sayeeshwara
Balaji Govinda Sayeeshwara (2)
Akhilanda Natha Ananda Roopa
Venkatesha Sai Venkatesha (3) [ Balaji Govinda ... ]
meaning: Salutations to Lord Sai who is verily Lord Venkatesha or Balaji who resides in Tirumala as Lord Govinda. He is the Lord of the whole Universe and the embodiment of happiness.

title: Sridhara Sundara Radhikeshwara
lyrics:
Gaana Priyakara Murali Manohara [ Sridhara Sundara ]
Natavara Giridhara Gopikeshwara
Sayeeshwara Sathya Sayeeshwara
meaning: The beautiful Lord Vishnu - who is the Lord of Lakshmi and adored by Radha, the Lord who is fond of music and beautiful to look at with his flute, who is the supreme actor and dancer, the Lord of the Gopis, one who lifted the Govardhana Mountain, He is none other than our Lord Sathya Sayeeshwara.

title: Srikari Krupakari Kshemankari Sayeeshwari
lyrics:
Shankari Abhayankari Shubhankari Sayeeshwari [ Srikari Krupakari ... ]
Tandavakeli Priyakari Bhairavi Pralayankari
Sarveshwari Sundari Dayakari Maheshwari
meaning: Glory be to the beautiful, compassionate and all pervading goddess Parvathi, the consort of Shankara (Shiva), the one who bestows auspiciousness, who looks after the welfare of devotees, who bestows fearlessness and who is fond of the 'Tandava' dance.

title: Srinivasa Govinda Sri Venkatesha Govinda
lyrics:
Purana Purusha Govinda Pundarikaaksha Govinda
Dashavidha Roopa Govinda Krishna Rama Govinda
Krishna Rama Govinda Rama Krishna Govinda
Sai Rama Govinda Sai Krishna Govinda
meaning: Chant the divine names Srinivasa, Govinda, Venkatesha - various names of Lord Balaji of Tirupati. He is Lord Narayana, the one who is the Lord of great Epics (Puranas) and the one who has taken ten incarnations. He is verily Lord Sai, who is the same Lord who incarnated as Rama and Krishna.

title: Srinivasa Sri Venkatesha
lyrics:
Balaji Govinda Sayeesha [ Srinivasa Sri ... ]
Parama Dayala Tirumalai Vasa
Padma Lakshmi Vallabha Esha
Pundarikaaksha Paapa Vinasha
meaning: Chant the names of Lord Srinivasa of Tirupati also hailed as Venkatesha, Balaji, Govinda. O Lord, You are none other than Lord Sai. You are the compassionate Lord residing on the hills of Tirumala accompanied by Goddess Lakshmi. You are the lotus-eyed one who destroys our sins.

title: Srinivasa Sri Venkatesha
lyrics:
Dashavidha Roopa Govinda
Tirumalesha Govinda
Pundarikaaksha Govinda
Parthi Nivasa Govinda
Govinda Hari ( Sai ) Govinda (2)
meaning: Chant Lord Srinivasa, Sri Venkatesha who took ten forms. He is also adored as Pundarikaksha. He resides at Parthi. HE is Govinda, Hari and Sai Govinda. (All are names of Krishna)

title: Srinivasa Venkatesha
lyrics:
Shritha Jana Paripala Sayeesha [ Srinivasa ... ]
Tirumala Giri Vasa Govinda
Garuda Vahana Govinda Govinda
Govinda Govinda Srinivasa Govinda
Govinda Govinda Shirdi Vasa Govinda
Govinda Govinda Parthi Vasa Govinda
alt_lyrics:
Srinivasa Venkatesha
Shritha Jana Paripala Sayeesha [ Srinivasa ... ]
Tirupati Giri Vasa Govinda
Garuda Vahana Govinda Govinda
Govinda Govinda Srinivasa Govinda
Govinda Govinda Shirdi Vasa Govinda
Govinda Govinda Parthi Vasa Govinda
meaning: Sing the names of Lord Srinivasa, Venkatesha (names of Lord Vishnu) and Lord Sayeesha who protects all those who have surrendered to Him. Glory to Lord Govinda who resides in the Tirumala hills and the one who rides on Garuda.

title: Srishti Sthithi Layakara Amrutotbhavakara
lyrics:
Guru Brahma Guru Vishnu Guru Devo Maheshwara [ Srishti Sthithi ... ]
Lingodhbhavakara Shiva Shiva Shiva Shankara
Shambho Mahadeva Sai Parameshwara
meaning: Salutations to Lord Shiva who is responsible for creation, existence and destruction. He is the creator of Amrutha - the immortal nectar. He is the preceptor in the form of Trinity (Brahma, Vishnu and Maheshwara). Lord Sai who creates the of holy Shivalinga is none other than Lord Shiva.

title: Start the Day
lyrics:
Fill the day with love
Spend the day with love
End the day with love
That is the way to God (4)

title: Start the day with Love
lyrics:
Fill the day with Love
 End the day with Love
 That's the Golden road, the Golden way to Love
 Wake up your song in our heart Lord

title: Step Back
lyrics:
May the love of Sai
Give us what it takes
All the strength and light we need
To clear our mistakes
 
When we say step back, worry you don’t have a chance
Don’t have a chance, so you don’t have a chance
You better step back, worry you don’t have a chance
Don’t have a chance to bring us down
 
We know the Lord is present everyday
Guiding all that we do and we say
When we recognize it as His play
We see the world in a brand new way
 
Step back, jealousy, you don’t have a chance
Don’t have a chance, so you don’t have a chance
You better step back, jealousy you don’t have a chance
Don’t have a chance to bring us down
 
We know the Lord will give us all that we need
Happiness can overcome the greed
When we’re loving You with all of our hearts
We are content to follow His lead
 
Step back, anger, you don’t have a chance
Don’t have a chance, so you don’t have a chance
You better step back, anger you don’t have a chance
Don’t have a chance to bring us down
 
We know the Lord will shine through every race
Peering out from each form and face
When we see the light reflecting there
We know that God is flooding His grace
 
Step back, worry, you don’t have a chance
Don’t have a chance, so you don’t have a chance
You better step back, worry you don’t have a chance
Don’t have a chance to bring us down
 
No you don’t have a chance to bring us down

title: Stream of Love
lyrics:
Come to the waters, come to the waters
There’s a Stream of Love
Come to the shore, come to the shore
 
If you need some healin’ here’s how to begin
First you must put all of your trust in Spirit
Then, just wade on in [ There’s a Stream ... ]
 
If you’re constantly thirsty
And the world leaves you unsatisfied
Know that in all those places you’ve been seeking
There’s one place you might not have tried [ There’s a Stream ... ]
 
It’s been said that Love will cast out
Everything not of itself
If you will push aside all you’re afraid of
Reach up take Love off the shelf [ There’s a Stream ... ]

title: Subah Aur Shyam Bol Hari
title2: Subah Aur Shyam Bol Hari Naam
lyrics:
Gopi Gopala Bhajo Sai Ghana Shyam [ Subah Aur ... ]
Chalo Man Chalo Chaley Baba Ke Dham
Shirdi Ke Dhaam Sathya Sai Ke Dham
meaning: Chant the name of Lord Hari day in and day out. Chant Gopi, Gopala, Ghana Shyam (various names of Lord Krishna) and Sai who is verily Krishna. O Mind, let us proceed with our journey to the abodes of Shirdi Sai Baba and Sathya Sai Baba.

title: Subete no Inochi wa Anata
title2: Subete no Inochi wa Anata Kara Umareta
lyrics:
Subete wa Kami Desu, Subete wa Ai Desu
Anata no Kotoba wa Nani yori mo Amaku
Nani yori mo Tsuyoku, Tamashi he to Hibiku
Sathya Sai Baba, Sathya Sai Baba
Warera wo Michibikita mou Sathya Sai Baba no Ai

Sathya Sai Baba, Sathya Sai Baba
meaning: O Lord Sathya Sai, everything in this world was born for You. Everything is God, Everything is Love. Any word You speak is sweet. You give me the strength to return to You. Sathya Sai Baba, Your love has guided us.

title: Subete no Kokoro ni Yadoru Sai
title2: Subete no Kokoro ni Yadoru Sai
lyrics:
Kurushii Toki nimo Yasashiku Sukuu [ Subete no ... ]
Sai no Namae no Fushigina Chikara (Mugen no Chikara, Idai no Chikara)
Rinne no Umi wo Watashi tamae
Sai Ram Sai Ram Tonaete Inoru
meaning: Lord Sai, You live within everyone's heart. You help us with kindness even in difficult times. The name Sai has infinite, magnificent power. O Lord, You have reincarnated for us.

title: Subete wo Michibiku Seinaru Guru
title2: Subete wo Michibiku Seinaru Guru Sai Baba
lyrics:
Kami no Miwaza no Shinsei Hai de
Shiva no Jiai wo Arawashi Tamae [ Subete wo... ]
Hikari Afureru Sai Gopala
Kokoro no Sasae Sai Rama
Guru no Ai de Michibiki Tamae
meaning: Holy Guru Baba, You guide everything through Your godly ashes. Please reveal within me the love of Shiva. You are the light of Sai Gopala that overflows in me. You are Sai Rama who supports my heart. Please guide me with Your divine love.

title: Subete wo mimamoru hahanaru Sai
lyrics:
Yasashiku hohoemu jiai no Kami yo
Oh Baba Watashi no hikari
Anata ni idakarete hikari e kaeru
meaning: Mother Sai, you watch over everything with affection, kindness, and a smile. When I embrace you, and light will come.

title: Subrahmanya Maam Paahi Sai Natha
title2: Subrahmanya Maam Paahi Sai Natha Maam Paahi
lyrics:
Shambhu Kumara Maam Paahi Sharavana Bhava Guha Maam Paahi
Shanmukha Natha Maam Paahi Sai Natha Maam Paahi
Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Subrahmanyam Hara Hara Hara Hara Subrahmanyam
Shiva Shiva Bala Subrahmanyam Hara Hara Bala Subrahmanyam
Shiva Shiva Hara Hara Subrahmanyam Hara Hara Shiva Shiva Subrahmanyam
meaning: We take refuge in Lord Subrahmanya, son of Lord Shambhu (Lord Shiva) Praise Him as Sharavana.

title: Subrahmanya Namostuthey
lyrics:
Soora Samhara Namostuthey
Suramuni Pala Namostuthey
Kanda Kumara Namostuthey
Shambhu Kumara Namostuthey
Shankari Bala Namostuthey
Shanmukha Natha Namostuthey
Sai Natha Namostuthey (2)
meaning: Pray to Lord Subrahmanya, the destroyer of demon Soora. He is protector of pious sages and noble souls. He is the son of Mother Shankari (Parvathi). Our salutations to You, O Lord Sai.

title: Subrahmanyam Bol Hara Hara Subrahmanyam
title2: Subrahmanyam Bol Hara Hara Subrahmanyam Bol
lyrics:
Bolo Hara Hara Bolo Shiva Shiva Subrahmanyam Bol
Kanda Kumara Vela Muruga Subrahmanyam Bol [ Bolo Hara Hara ... ]
Subrahmanyam Bol Hara Hara (Shiva Shiva) Subrahmanyam Bol
Shanmukha Natha Sharavana Deva Subrahmanyam Bol [ Bolo Hara Hara ... ]
meaning: Sing the name of Lord Subrahmanya, son of Lord Shiva. He is also praised as Lord Kanda, Shanmukha, and Sharavana. He is the six-faced one who bears the golden spear (Vel).

title: Subrahmanyam Sai Bolo Subrahmanyam Sai
lyrics:
(Bolo) Shanmukha Natha Subrahmanyam Subrahmanyam Sai
(Bolo) Sai Natha Subrahmanyam Subrahmanyam Sai 
Subrahmanyam Subrahmanyam Subrahmanyam Sai [ (Bolo) Shanmukha Natha ... ]
Subrahmanyam Subrahmanyam Subrahmanyam Sai [ (Bolo) Shanmukha Natha ... ]
meaning: Chant the name of Lord Subrahmanya, the Lord who has six faces. He has incarnated as our beloved Lord Sathya Sai.

title: Subrahmanyam Subrahmanyam
lyrics:
Subrahmanyam Subrahmanyam Sai Natha Subrahmanyam
Shiva Shiva Shiva Shiva Subrahmanyam Hara Hara Hara Hara Subrahmanyam
Shiva Shiva Hara Hara Subrahmanyam Hara Hara Shiva Shiva Subrahmanyam
Shiva Sharavana Bhava Subrahmanyam Guru Sharavana Bhava Subrahmanyam
Shiva Shiva Hara Hara Subrahmanyam Hara Hara Shiva Shiva Subrahmanyam
meaning: We take refuge in Lord Subrahmanya and praise Him as Sharavana. Glory to Lord Subrahmanya and Lord Sai Natha.

title: Sumiran Kar Man Naam Prabhu
title2: Sumiran Kar Man Naam Prabhu Ka
lyrics:
Parthi Puri Ke Sai Prabhu Ka [ Sumiran Kar ]
Kamal Nayana Prabhu Sundara Shyama
Karley Sumiran Sai Rama
meaning: Oh Mind meditate upon the form of Lord Sai of Parthi, He is none other than the Lotus eyed Lord Krishna. Meditate upon the form of Lord Sai Rama.

title: Sun Ley Pukar Sai Murali
lyrics:
Madhura Murali Mangala Murali
Mohana Murali Mukunda Murali
Sumadhura Murali Sunaada Murali
Madhava Murali Yadava Murali
Madhumathi Radha Lola Murali
Madhuvana Sanchari Shyama Murali
meaning: O Lord Krishna of Yadava clan, please listen to my appeal, You are the Murali krishna who raptures everyone with sublime, sweet lilting music on Your flute going around the beautiful forest with Radha as consort.

title: Sunaada Vinodini Sai Janani
lyrics:
Bhavani Jaganmohini Sai Janani [ Sunaada Vinodini ... ]
Sambhavi Shiva Ranjani Sai Janani
Shankari Narayani Sai Janani
Bhagawathi Vara Dayini Sai Janani
meaning: Glory to Mother Sai who enjoys music and who has several forms and names - Bhavani who enchants the whole world, Sambhavi, who pleases and entertains Lord Shiva, Shankari, Narayani and Bhagawathi who bestows boons to all.

title: Sunaada Vinodini Suhaasini
lyrics:
Anatha Rakshaki Sri Bhuvaneshwari
Abhaya Pradayini Ananda Roopini
meaning: The Divine Mother revels in sacred music, is bliss personified, protector of helpless and needy and the one who bestows solace to all.

title: Sundar Sundar Sai Sundar
lyrics:
Kamala Nayana Sai Ram (2) [ Sundar Sundar … ]
Parthipuri Mey Janam Liya
Bhakthon Ka Uddhaar Kiya
Patitha Pavana Pavana Naam [ Kamala Nayana ... ]
Jai Jai Ram Ram Ram Sai Ram Ram Ram
meaning: Salutations to the most beautiful Lord Sai Ram, the one with lotus-petal eyes who incarnated in Puttaparthi to liberate the devotees. Chant the Holy name of Lord Sai, the sole refuge of the downtrodden.

title: Sundara Mukha Sri Gajanana
lyrics:
Eka Dantha Sri Gajanana [ Sundara Mukha ... ]
Prathama Namami Gajanana
Rishi Muni Vanditha Gajanana
Gajanana Om Gajanana (3)
meaning: Salutations to Lord Ganesh, the beautiful elephant-faced Lord with a single tusk and the one whom the entire universe worships first. The wise and noble sages too worship Him first.

title: Sundara Paadam Sai Paadam
lyrics:
Pankaja Charanam Paapa Vimochanam [ Sundara Paadam ... ]
Nataraja Natanam Sai Paadam
Sri Krishna Narthanam Sai Paadam
Bhava Dukha Haranam Sai Paadam
Jagadodharanam Sai Paadam
meaning: The feet of Sai are beautiful. The feet, which are soft like Lotus petals relieves us from our sins. The feet of Sai are the dancing feet of Lord Shiva and that of Lord Krishna. The feet of Sai provide solace from the trials and tribulations in our lives and they are the feet that uplift the world from miseries and calamities.

title: Sundara Rama Sai Rama
lyrics:
Sugunatheetha Megha Shyama
Srishti Sthithi Laya Karana Rama
Munijana Poojita Taraka Naama
Sath Chith Ananda Swaroopa Naam (2)
Sai Ram Sai Ram (4)
meaning: Oh Beautiful Rama, your virtues are of highest order, your color is that of dark clouds, you are responsible for Creation and existence, you are adored by sages, you are the liberator from the cycle of birth and death and you are always in bliss.

title: Sundara Sai Shankara Potri
lyrics:
Nangu Vedattin Nadane Potri [ Sundara Sai ... ]
Uma Mahesha Hara Hara Potri
Unmai Porule Shiva Shiva Potri
Adi Andam Illa Ishane Potri
Ambalattadum Iraivane Potri
meaning: Glory be unto Lord Shankara (Shiva), the Lord of the four Vedas, the Lord of Uma, the only existing reality, without a beginning or end. Lord Sai embodies Shiva who dances in the temple of our hearts.

title: Sundara Shyam Nayanabhi Ram
lyrics:
Hey Ghana Shyam Nayanabhi Ram
Natavara Shyam Nayanabhi Ram
Radhey Shyam Nayanabhi Ram
Sai Shyam Nayanabhi Ram
alt_lyrics:
Sundara Shyam Nayanabhi Ram
Hey Ghana Shyam Nayanabhi Ram
Natavara Shyam Nayanabhi Ram
Parthi Shyam Nayanabhi Ram
Sai Shyam Nayanabhi Ram
meaning: This song extols Lord Krishna as the blue, dark complexioned Shyama, the supreme dancer and actor, the Lord of Radha who is very beautiful and enchanting for the eyes.

title: Sundara Shyama Gopala Sai Radhe
title2: Sundara Shyama Gopala Sai Radhey Govinda Govinda
lyrics:
Jaya Radhey Jaya Radhey Radhey Gopala Gopala [ Sundara Shyama ... ]
Radha Jeevana Shyama Sai Radhey Govinda Govinda
Jaya Gopala Radhey Radhey Radhey Gopala Gopala
meaning: Sing the different names of Lord Krishna - Govinda, Gopala. Victory to the dark-complexioned and beautiful Krishna who is the very life of Radha.

title: Sundara Shyama Murari Sai
lyrics:
Gopala Sri Hari Sri Hari (2)
Parama Niranjana Madhava Sai
Sakala Charachara Vyapaka Sai [ Gopala Sri ... ]
meaning: Sing the praises of beautiful Lord Sai, who is none other than Lord Krishna also known as Shyama Murari, Gopala, Sri Hari and Madhava. Lord Sai is eternally pure and encompasses all the animate and inanimate things.

title: Sundara Sugunabhi Rama Rama
lyrics:
Mandara Makaranda Madhurya Naama Rama [ Sundara Sugunabhi ... ]
Kodanda Mandita Ranadheera Rama Rama
Ananda Mandira Rama
Rama Jai Jai Ram Sri Rama Jai Jai Ram (3)
meaning: Oh Beautiful and Virtuous Rama, Your name is sweeter than honey. Oh Rama, with the Kodanda (the Sacred Bow) in hand You are the personification of Valor in the battle. You are the temple of Bliss. Victory to You, Oh Rama.

title: Sundara Sundara Nachey Sundara Sai
title2: Sundara Sundara Nachey Sundara Sai Ghana Shyam
lyrics:
Nacherey Sai Sundara Shyam
Rhumaka Jhumaka Jhum Ghungaroo Baajey Nachey Ghana Shyam
Nachey Natavara Sai Sundara Merey Sai Ram
Nachey Nachey Man Mandir Mey Merey Sai Ram [ Nacherey ... ]
meaning: O the most beautiful, dark-complexioned Lord Krishna, it is a treat for the eyes and ears when the You dance with the anklets jingling on Thy little feet, which go in rhythm to the tune. O Lord, please dance in our hearts the same way for the song of our life.

title: Sundara Sundara Sai Sundara
lyrics:
Sundara Nanda Gopala
Gopala Sai Gopala
Murali Madhava Mohana Roopa
Munijana Manasa Chora
Chitha Chora Maakhan Chora
meaning: Salutations to the enchanting son of Nanda, Lord Gopala (Krishna), the one who loves the music of the flute, the one who steals butter as well as the hearts of sages and the one who is verily Lord Sai.

title: Sundara Sundara Vinayaka
lyrics:
Shubha Mangala Dayaka Vinayaka
Vighna Koti Hara Vimala Gajanana
Sakala Vighna Hara Sai Gajanana
Eshwari Nandana Parthi Gajanana
Jai Jai Ganesha Jai Sri Ganesha (4)
meaning: Victory to Lord Ganesha who is very beautiful, who bestows everything good and auspicious. He is the remover of millions of obstacles that come in our way. He is the elephant-faced son of Parvathi and is verily Lord Sai who resides in Parthi.

title: Sundara Vadana Gopala
lyrics:
Nayana Sunayana Hey Nandalala [Sundara Vadana ... ]
Meera Ke Prabhu Giridhara Bala
Radha Jeevana Sai Gopala
meaning: Oh Lord Gopala (Krishna), You are most enchanting with beautiful eyes. Oh son of Nanda, Lord of Meera and the very life of Radha, You are none other than Sai.

title: Sundara Vadana Sarasija Nayana
lyrics:
Parthi Puri Bhagawan
Jagat Paripala Prashanthi Nilaya
Tum Ho Merey Bhagawan
Daya Karo Bhagawan
Krupa Karo Bhagawan
Parthi Pureesha Hey Bhuvanesha
Raksha (Sai Krupa) Karo Bhagawan
meaning: O Sai, Lord of Parthi, the one with eyes like Lotus, the one who has a beautiful face, who protects and sustains the world and who resides in Prashanthi Nilayam, You are my Lord. Please have compassion on me and shower Your grace on me O Lord of the World.

title: Sundara Vadani Suguna Manohari
lyrics:
Manda Haasa Mukha Shashi Vadani
Chandana Kumkuma Alankruta Vadani
Sai Maheshwari Raja Rajeshwari
Om Shakthi Om Om Shakthi Om Om Shakthi Om Om Shakthi Om (2)
meaning: Chant the name 'Om Shakthi Om' repeatedly, which extols the Divine Mother as Maheshwari (great Goddess), virtuous Goddess of Emperors, having a blissful smile with the sandal paste and vermillion on Her beautiful face and who is verily Mother Sai.

title: Sundari Soundari Suguna Manohari
lyrics:
Shankari Sambhavi Sayeeshwari (2)
Nithya Niranjani Niramayi
Ranjani Rakshaki Sathya Sayeeshwari
meaning: The Divine Mother is beauty personified, highly virtuous, consort of Shankara (Shiva), ever blemishless, the one who protects Her devotees and is none other than Mother Sathya Sai.

title: Sunle Pukar Sai Murali (2)
lyrics:
Madhura Murali Mangala Murali
Mohana Murali Mukunda Murali
Sumadhura Murali Sunaada Murali
Madhava Murali Yadava Murali
Madhumathi Radha Lola Murali
Madhuvana Sanchari Shyama Murali
meaning: Krishna, Lord of Radha, and prince of the Yadavas, bestows prosperity and well-being. The beautiful Lord plays the flute ever so sweetly, in the gardens (Brindavan). Please listen to my prayers.

title: Suprabhatham
lyrics:
Poorva Sandhya Pravarthathe
Utthishta Sathya Sayeesha
Karthavyam Daivamanhikam

Utthishthothishta Partheesha
Utthishta Jagateepathe
Utthishta Karunapoorna
Lokamangala Siddhaye

Chithravathi Thata Vishala Sushantha Soudhe
Thishtanthi Sevakajanas Thava Darshanartham
Aditya Kanthiranubhathi Samastha Lokan
Sri Sathya Sai Bhagawan, Thava Suprabhatham

Thvannama Keerthana Rathasthava Divyanama
Gayanthi Bhakthi Rasapana Prahrishta Chitthaha
Dathum Krupasahitha Darshanamashu Thebhyaha
Sri Sathya Sai Bhagawan, Thava Suprabhatham

Adaya Divya Kusumani Manoharani
Sripada Poojanavidhim Bhavadanghri Moole
Karthum Mahothsukathaya Pravishanthi Bhakthaha
Sri Sathya Sai Bhagawan, Thava Suprabhatham

Deshantharagatha Budhasthava Divyamoorthim
Sandarshnabhirathi Samyutha Chitthavruthya
Vedokthamantra Patanena Lasanthyajasram
Sri Sathya Sai Bhagawan, Thava Suprabhatham

Shruthva Thavadbhutha Charithram Akhanda Keerthim
Vyaptham Diganthara Vishala Dharathalesmin
Jignasuloka Upathishtathi Chashramesmin
Sri Sathya Sai Bhagawan, Thava Suprabhatham

Sita Sathi Sama Vishuddha Hrudambhujathaha
Bahvangana Karagruheetha Supushpa Haraha
Sthunvanthi Divyanuthibhih Phanibhooshanam Thvam
Sri Sathya Sai Bhagawan, Thava Suprabhatham

Suprabhatham Idam Punyam
Ye Patanthi Dine Dine
The Vishanthi Parandhama
Jnana Vijnana Shobhithaha

Mangalam Guru Devaya
Mangalam Jnana Dayine
Mangalam Parthi Vasaya
Mangalam Sathya Sayine
meaning:
‘Su’ means good, auspicious and ‘Prabhath’ means morning. ‘Suprabhatam’ refers to the morning prayers that are chanted in praise of the Lord to awaken the divinity present within each individual. It is the act of dedicating oneself to the Lord and praying for His blessings right at the start of a new day.
 
1. O Son of Easwaramba! O Resplendent Majestic One! Dawn is heralding in the East. The daily tasks of Divinity, which Thou hast undertaken has to be accomplished, therefore, awake, O Lord Sathya Sai!
